data.name: Statement_Abundance
data.value: Feng: indicates progress and development. A king (as if) approached it. Be not anxious. Let it be like the sun at noon. Decision: Feng means great. (The trigram for) light (Fire) and that for movement (Thunder) are combined; hence the figure indicates abundance. 'A king (as if) approached it' - his mind is set on what is great. 'Be not anxious. Let it be like the sun at noon' - for it is right that (the sun) should shine over all the world. When the sun has reached its meridian height, it begins to decline. When the moon has become full, it begins to wane. The heaven and earth's conditions of abundance and attenuation wax and wane in accordance with the seasons. How much more is it so with the fate of humans, and (the operations of) the spirits and gods? Image: (The trigrams for) thunder and lightning come together, forming the image of Feng (Abundance). The superior man, in accordance with this, decides cases of litigation and inflicts punishments (clearly and promptly).

data.name: Statement_TheCreative
data.value: Qian: what is great and originating, penetrating, advantageous, correct and firm. Decision: The Judgment on the Decision says: Vast is the great and originating (power) indicated by Qian! All things owe to it their beginning, and it comprehends all the heavens. The clouds move and the rain is distributed; the various things appear in their developed forms. (The sages) comprehend the changes (taking place in the six lines of the hexagram), and (so) make clear the issue (of events) from the beginning to the end (of the hexagram). Thus (they show) how (the six lines) mount the dragon (each in its proper place) according to the time, and are thereby borne along (as if) through the sky. The method of Qian is to change and transform, so that everything obtains its correct nature as appointed (by the mind of Heaven); and (thereafter the conditions of) great harmony are preserved in union. The result is 'what is advantageous,' and 'correct and firm.' (The sage) appears aloft, high above all things, and the myriad states all enjoy repose. Image: The movement of heaven is full of power. Thus the superior man makes himself strong and untiring.
data.comment: Judgment, Decision and Image about Qian Wei Tian

data.name: LineStatement_TheCreative-5
data.value: Flying dragon in the heavens. It will be advantageous to meet with the great man.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCreative-1
data.value: Hidden dragon. Do not act.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCreative-4
data.value: (The dragon is) looking as if he were leaping up, but still in the deep. There will be no mistake.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCreative-2
data.value: Dragon appearing in the field. It will be advantageous to meet with the great man.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCreative-6
data.value: The arrogant dragon will have cause to repent.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCreative-3
data.value: The superior man is active and vigilant all the day, and in the evening still careful and apprehensive. (The position is) dangerous, but there will be no mistake.

data.name: LineStatement_Abundance-1
data.value: He meets his complementary ruler. Though they are (both) of the same character, there will be no blame. If he go forward, he will be praised.
data.comment: Lei Huo Feng first line text

data.name: LineStatement_Abundance-2
data.value: He makes his abundance (like) a great tent. At noon he sees the (Great) Dipper (Ursa Major). If he go forward, he will be mistrusted and disliked. Let him show his sincerity, and thereby afford ground for joy. There will be good fortune.
data.comment: Lei Huo Feng second line text

data.name: LineStatement_Abundance-3
data.value: He makes his abundance (like) a covering flag. At noon he sees the small star. He breaks his right arm. There will be no blame.
data.comment: Lei Huo Feng third line text

data.name: LineStatement_Abundance-4
data.value: He makes his abundance (like) a great tent. At noon he sees the (Great) Dipper. He meets with the ruler (who is his) counterpart. There will be good fortune.
data.comment: Lei Huo Feng fourth line text

data.name: LineStatement_Abundance-5
data.value: The (ruler) is represented by the (fifth line, divided and) central. The result is 'brilliance.' There will be cause for congratulation and praise. There will be good fortune.
data.comment: Lei Huo Feng fifth line text

data.name: LineStatement_Abundance-6
data.value: He makes his house large. He screens his family (from the world). He peeps through his door. It is still, and no one is (seen) there. For three years no one appears. There will be evil.
data.comment: Lei Huo Feng top line text

data.name: Statement_ComingToMeet
data.value: Gòu: indicates (the condition of) a (strong) woman. Do not take (such a one) as your wife. Decision: Gòu means 'an encounter,' the weak (line) encountering the strong (ones). 'Do not take such a one as your wife' – (for) one cannot live together with her permanently. (Yet) when Heaven and Earth encounter each other, all things are displayed in their glory. When the strong (ruler, the fifth nine) meets with what is central and correct, his influence greatly prevails under heaven. Great indeed is the significance of the time of Gòu! Image: Under heaven there is wind – this forms the image of Gòu. The sovereign, in accordance with this, issues his commands and proclaims them to the four quarters (of the world).

data.name: Statement_Retreat
data.value: Dùn: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) it will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune for the small man, but the great man will experience misfortune. The flight of the fowl supplies the means of advance. Decision: In Dùn, we have the weak (line, the fourth six) mounted on the strong (lines above). 'There will be good fortune for the small man' - (because) he is compliant and yielding. 'The great man will experience misfortune' - (because) he is in the place of a minister when the time is unfavorable. 'The flight of the fowl supplies the means of advance' - (because) he cannot stay in his position. The meaning of the hexagram is expressed in the movement of the lower trigram (Zhen, Thunder) which penetrates and enters into the lower part of the upper trigram (Gèn, Mountain). Image: The mountain under heaven - this forms the image of Dùn. The superior man, in accordance with this, keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: Statement_Standstill
data.value: Pǐ: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. In such circumstances, the superior man will stop and consider what he should do. The great depart, and the small approach. Decision: Pǐ means obstruction. 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when (Heaven and Earth) are in communication and harmony, all things are completed and united. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) when the superior and inferior (classes of men) are in communication, their aims are the same. 'The great depart, and the small approach' - (because) when (Heaven and Earth) are out of communication, all things are disunited and fail to grow. Image: Heaven and earth do not unite - this forms the image of Pǐ. The superior man, in accordance with this, reduces his expenditures and retrenches his revenues, and employs men of worth, with a view to improvement of morals.

data.name: Statement_Contemplation
data.value: Guān: shows (the ruler) as he is present in his religious washing (before the sacrifice), but not yet presenting the offerings. (His) sincere devotion inspires reverence (in all beholders). Decision: The great act of contemplation is displayed from above. (The hexagram indicates) docility and penetration. (The ruler, the fifth line) being central and correct, contemplates (and is contemplated by) all under heaven. 'Guān shows (the ruler) as he is present in his religious washing, but not yet presenting the offerings. His sincere devotion inspires reverence' – those below contemplate him and are transformed. (He) contemplates the divine way of Heaven, whereby the four seasons proceed without error. The holy sage, in accordance with this divine way, establishes his instruction, and all under heaven yield submission to him. Image: The wind moves over the earth – this forms the image of Guān. The ancient kings, in accordance with this, inspected the regions (of the kingdom), observed the people, and established instruction (according to their needs).

data.name: Statement_SplittingApart
data.value: Bō: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) it will not be advantageous to make any movement. That will be advantageous which tends to promote the separation and dispersion (of what has been united). Decision: Bō means 'splitting apart.' 'It will not be advantageous to make any movement' - (because) when (Heaven and Earth) are separated and disunited, all things lose their mutual attraction and cohesion. 'That will be advantageous which tends to promote separation' - (because) when the superior and inferior (classes of men) are in mutual opposition, there is no union of aim and action. 'In such circumstances, the superior man will stop and consider what he should do' - (because) his virtue is great and brilliant, and he must not allow himself to be involved in the prevailing confusion. Image: The mountain rests on the earth - this forms the image of Bō. The superior man, in accordance with this, seeks alliances with men of worth and ability, in order to restore order and unity.

data.name: Statement_Progress
data.value: Jìn: indicates that (under its conditions) the superior man will be crowned with success. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream (to embark on important enterprises). Decision: Jìn means 'advance.' 'The superior man will be crowned with success' - (because) he adheres to what is correct and proper. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) he is assisted by the central and correct position of the fifth line (the ruler). Darkness disappears, and light advances. 'The prince offers sacrifice to his ancestral temple' - (because) he is in accord with the season (for such ceremonies). Image: The sun shines above the earth - this forms the image of Jìn. The superior man, in accordance with this, discards all that is mean and low in his character, and aims at what is noble and lofty.

data.name: Statement_PossessionInGreatMeasure
data.value: Dà Yǒu: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Advantage will be found in having the assistance of the great man. Decision: Dà Yǒu means 'possession in great measure.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) the strong (line, the fifth nine) is in the central position, and responds to the weak (line, the second six) which is also central. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) the ruler is in the correct position, and the ministers are loyal and devoted. 'Advantage will be found in having the assistance of the great man' - (because) there is perfect harmony between the ruler and his ministers. Image: Fire in heaven above - this forms the image of Dà Yǒu. The superior man, in accordance with this, restrains evil and promotes good, in accordance with the benevolent will of Heaven.

data.name: LineStatement_ComingToMeet-1
data.value: Tied to a metal brake-block. Perseverance brings good fortune. To go forward (actively) leads to misfortune. (Like) a lean pig that is sure to keep jumping and frisking about. Image: 'Tied to a metal brake-block' – (this indicates) the way of the weak (line) is to be restrained.

data.name: LineStatement_ComingToMeet-2
data.value: There is a fish in the baul (wrapping). No blame. (But) it is not advantageous for (entertaining) guests. Image: 'There is a fish in the baul' – (meaning) in righteousness, it should not extend to guests.

data.name: LineStatement_ComingToMeet-3
data.value: No skin on his buttocks; he walks with difficulty. There is peril, but no great blame. Image: 'He walks with difficulty' – (but) his movement is not (yet) influenced (by the weak line).

data.name: LineStatement_ComingToMeet-4
data.value: No fish in the baul. To stir (to action) leads to misfortune. Image: The misfortune of 'no fish' – (is due to) being distant from the people (the yin element below).

data.name: LineStatement_ComingToMeet-5
data.value: (He acts) like the willow that overshadows the melon (below). He contains his brilliance within. (Then) something will fall from heaven (to him). Image: 'The fifth nine contains his brilliance' – (because of) his central and correct position. 'Something will fall from heaven' – (for) his will does not neglect the ordinances (of Heaven).

data.name: LineStatement_ComingToMeet-6
data.value: Encountering with his horn (i.e., in the highest, most remote place). There is humiliation, but no blame. Image: 'Encountering with his horn' – (means) being at the top, one is in an exhausted and humiliating position.

data.name: LineStatement_Retreat-1
data.value: At the commencement of retreat, there is danger. Nothing would be advantageous. Image: 'At the commencement of retreat, there is danger' – (because) the strong (line) is close (to the weak one).

data.name: LineStatement_Retreat-2
data.value: He holds (his purpose) fast as if bound with cords and ropes, and (is placed) in a stock or wooden cage. Image: 'He holds (his purpose) fast as if bound' – (because) he is in the central position, and is obedient.

data.name: LineStatement_Retreat-3
data.value: He nourishes (his) excellence as with rich food, and (is placed) in a carriage drawn by bronze horses. He is favored by the ruler, who gives him audience. Image: 'He nourishes (his) excellence as with rich food' – (because) he is in the central position, and responds to (the ruler above).

data.name: LineStatement_Retreat-4
data.value: He advances (like a rabbit) and finds no resting-place. To go forward would be dangerous. To remain where he is would be right. Image: 'To remain where he is would be right' – (because) he cannot be in the central position.

data.name: LineStatement_Retreat-5
data.value: He rightly obtains the praise (due to him), and in his dwelling-place there is good fortune. He has obtained the (right) position, and is free from anxiety. Image: 'He rightly obtains the praise (due to him)' – (because) he is in the central position, and is correct.

data.name: LineStatement_Retreat-6
data.value: He advances (like a bird) and finds no resting-place. To go forward would be dangerous. To remain where he is would be right. There is no peace for the restless. Image: 'To remain where he is would be right' – (because) he cannot be in the central position.

data.name: LineStatement_Standstill-1
data.value: When ribbon grass is pulled up, the sod comes with it. Each one finds his mates. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. Image: 'When ribbon grass is pulled up, the sod comes with it' – (because) corresponding (elements) are moved together.

data.name: LineStatement_Standstill-2
data.value: The superior man has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage. He puts aside his (ornamental) vessels. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them. Image: 'The superior man has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage' – (because) his will is set on what is great.

data.name: LineStatement_Standstill-3
data.value: He hides his light, and keeps his person retired and unknown. He maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them. There is no blame. Image: 'He hides his light' – (because) his brightness is obscured.

data.name: LineStatement_Standstill-4
data.value: He wraps (his light) as with sackcloth. He keeps his person retired and unknown. He maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them. There is no blame. Image: 'He wraps (his light) as with sackcloth' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: LineStatement_Standstill-5
data.value: He rightly obtains the praise (due to him), and in his dwelling-place there is good fortune. He has obtained the (right) position, and is free from anxiety. Image: 'He rightly obtains the praise (due to him)' – (because) he is in the central position, and is correct.

data.name: LineStatement_Standstill-6
data.value: He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage. He puts aside his (ornamental) vessels. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them. Image: 'He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage' – (because) his will is set on what is great.

data.name: LineStatement_Contemplation-1
data.value: Contemplation like a child. For a common man, no blame. For a superior man, humiliation. Image: 'The first six contemplates like a child' – this is the way of a common man.

data.name: LineStatement_Contemplation-2
data.value: Peeping contemplation. Advantageous for the perseverance of a woman. Image: 'Peeping contemplation advantageous for a woman' – (but for a man) it is also shameful.

data.name: LineStatement_Contemplation-3
data.value: Contemplating my own life (or: course). (I consider) advance and retreat. Image: 'Contemplating my own course, considering advance and retreat' – (he) does not miss the right way.

data.name: LineStatement_Contemplation-4
data.value: Contemplating the glory of the kingdom. It is advantageous to be a guest of the king. Image: 'Contemplating the glory of the kingdom' – (he is one) who honors (and is fit to be) a guest.

data.name: LineStatement_Contemplation-5
data.value: Contemplating my own life (or: people). For a superior man, no blame. Image Translation: 'Contemplating my own life' – (means) contemplating the people.

data.name: LineStatement_Contemplation-6

data.name: Statement_TheJoyous
data.value: Duì: indicates that (under its conditions) it will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune. There will be error if the firm correctness be not maintained. Decision: Duì means 'joyous.' 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) joy in company with what is great leads to the perfection of virtue. 'There will be good fortune' - (because) the strong (line, the ninth) is in the central position, and responds to the weak (line, the sixth) which is also central. 'There will be error if the firm correctness be not maintained' - (because) the joy must be regulated by propriety and reason. Image: Lakes resting one upon another - this forms the image of Duì. The superior man, in accordance with this, discusses crimes and pardons, and makes his decisions with deliberation.

data.name: Statement_Oppression
data.value: Kùn: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. (But) great difficulties must not be encountered. Decision: Kùn means 'distress' or 'oppression.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when a superior man is in distress, he examines himself and cultivates his virtues. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) sincerity and firmness will eventually overcome all obstacles. 'Great difficulties must not be encountered' - (because) in times of oppression, rash action leads to greater trouble. Image: Water over a lake - this forms the image of Kùn. The superior man, in accordance with this, bestows his favors and does not exhaust his resources.

data.name: Statement_GatheringTogether
data.value: Cuì: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. (But) great difficulties must not be encountered. It will be advantageous to make appointments of officers of merit. Decision: Cuì means 'gathering together.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when people unite with one heart, they can accomplish great things. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) sincerity and unity are essential for lasting success. 'Great difficulties must not be encountered' - (because) in gathering people together, force should not be used. 'It will be advantageous to make appointments of officers of merit' - (because) wise leadership is needed to unite people effectively. Image: A lake on the earth - this forms the image of Cuì. The superior man, in accordance with this, repairs his weapons and prepares his defenses.

data.name: Statement_Influence
data.value: Xián: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be success and progress. Perseverance brings advantage. Taking a maiden to wife brings good fortune. Decision: Xián means 'mutual influence' or 'attraction.' 'There will be success and progress' - (because) when feelings of sympathy and affection exist between people, they naturally attract and influence each other. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) sincerity and constancy are essential in all relationships. 'Taking a maiden to wife brings good fortune' - (because) the union of male and female represents the fundamental principle of nature. Image: A lake on a mountain - this forms the image of Xián. The superior man, in accordance with this, keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: LineStatement_Influence-1
data.value: The influence shows itself in the big toe. Image: 'The influence shows itself in the big toe' - his will is directed outward.

data.name: LineStatement_Influence-2
data.value: The influence shows itself in the calves of the legs. There will be evil, but if you abide as in correct position, there will be good fortune. Image: 'Though there is evil, yet good fortune comes from abiding in correct position' - because compliance will do no harm.

data.name: LineStatement_Influence-3
data.value: The influence shows itself in the thighs. Holds to what he follows. To go forward will be cause for regret. Image: 'The influence shows itself in the thighs, and he holds to what he follows' - he does not remain in his position. His will is set on following others, and what he holds is low.

data.name: LineStatement_Influence-4
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. Removal of regret. The influence shows itself in the upper part of the back. Friends come as one thinks of them. Image: 'Perseverance brings good fortune. Removal of regret' - there is no failure of the influence. 'Friends come as one thinks of them' - the influence is not yet brilliant.

data.name: LineStatement_Influence-5
data.value: The influence shows itself in the muscles of the jaws and cheeks. No regret. Image: 'The influence shows itself in the jaws and cheeks' - the will is set on what is external.

data.name: LineStatement_Influence-6
data.value: The influence shows itself in the jaws, cheeks, and tongue. Image: 'The influence shows itself in the jaws, cheeks, and tongue' - it shows itself by opening the mouth.

data.name: Statement_Obstruction
data.value: Jiǎn: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) the superior man will be able to make progress. But he must cultivate the qualities represented by the central and correct position of the fifth line. Decision: Jiǎn means 'obstruction' or 'difficulty.' 'The superior man will be able to make progress' - (because) when difficulties arise, a wise man examines himself and cultivates his virtues. 'He must cultivate the qualities represented by the central and correct position' - (because) in times of difficulty, the middle path and correct principles are essential for success. 'Going forward brings praise' - (because) perseverance and determination will eventually overcome all obstacles. Image: A mountain on water - this forms the image of Jiǎn. The superior man, in accordance with this, turns back upon himself and examines his character, cultivating his virtues.

data.name: LineStatement_Obstruction-1
data.value: Going forward brings praise, coming back brings disgrace. Image: 'Going forward brings praise, coming back brings disgrace' - it is right to wait.

data.name: LineStatement_Obstruction-2
data.value: The royal servant relieves the difficulty with great strength. No blame. Image: 'The royal servant relieves the difficulty with great strength' - because he is central and correct.

data.name: LineStatement_Obstruction-3
data.value: Going forward and returning brings difficulty. Image: The difficulty arises from his position not being appropriate for the task.

data.name: LineStatement_Obstruction-4
data.value: Going forward brings union. Coming back brings fame. Image: 'Going forward brings union, coming back brings fame' - because he holds to the right course.

data.name: LineStatement_Obstruction-5
data.value: Great difficulty. Friends come to help. Image: 'Great difficulty, friends come to help' - because he holds to the middle course.

data.name: LineStatement_Obstruction-6
data.value: Going forward brings difficulty. Coming back brings great good fortune. Advantageous to see great men. Image: 'Going forward brings difficulty, coming back brings great good fortune' - because his course is exhausted. 'Advantageous to see great men' - because his conduct is right.

data.name: Statement_Modesty
data.value: Qiān: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. The superior man will achieve his purpose by means of small advances. Decision: Qiān means 'modesty' or 'humility.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) modesty is a virtue that leads to the perfection of character. 'The superior man will achieve his purpose by means of small advances' - (because) humility and gradual progress are more sustainable than rash action. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) modesty enables one to overcome great difficulties. Image: A mountain within the earth - this forms the image of Qiān. The superior man, in accordance with this, reduces his faults and cultivates his virtues.

data.name: LineStatement_Modesty-1
data.value: A superior man modest and humbling himself. He may cross the great stream. Good fortune. Image: 'A superior man modest and humbling himself' - he shows humility to those below.

data.name: LineStatement_Modesty-2
data.value: Modesty and harmony. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: 'Modesty and harmony' - because he follows the middle course.

data.name: LineStatement_Modesty-3
data.value: Meritorious modesty. The superior man will achieve his purpose. Good fortune. Image: The merit comes from his meritorious modesty, showing his ability.

data.name: LineStatement_Modesty-4
data.value: Nothing that would not be advantageous to modesty. No blame. Image: 'Nothing that would not be advantageous to modesty' - because he does not dare to display his ability.

data.name: LineStatement_Modesty-5
data.value: Not enriching your neighbor through modesty. Advantageous to attack. Nothing that would not be advantageous. Image: 'Not enriching your neighbor through modesty' - because he applies his humility.

data.name: LineStatement_Modesty-6
data.value: Modesty that sounds forth. Advantageous to have armies and set cities in motion. Image: 'Modesty that sounds forth' - because his will cannot yet be directed.

data.name: Statement_PreponderanceOfTheSmall
data.value: Xiǎo Guò: indicates that (under its conditions) success will come through small efforts. Perseverance brings advantage. It will be advantageous to meet with the great man. (But) let there be no attempt to perform great exploits. Decision: Xiǎo Guò means 'preponderance of the small.' 'Success will come through small efforts' - (because) in small matters, attention to detail and careful execution lead to success. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) constancy in small things builds the foundation for greater achievements. 'It will be advantageous to meet with the great man' - (because) wise counsel is needed in times of small preponderance. 'Let there be no attempt to perform great exploits' - (because) attempting great things when the time is for small actions leads to failure. Image: Thunder on the mountain - this forms the image of Xiǎo Guò. The superior man, in accordance with this, is careful in his speech and temperate in his conduct.

data.name: Statement_TheMarryingMaiden
data.value: Guī Mèi: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. But it will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Guī Mèi means 'the marrying maiden.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) the union of man and woman represents the fundamental principle of nature. 'But it will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) in matters of marriage and relationships, propriety and moral principles must be maintained. 'The young lady who marries carries her basket, but without the fruits of the sacrifice' - (because) appearance without substance is empty. 'The lame man who can trample on the tiger's tail and does not bite him' - (because) weakness guided by wisdom can overcome strength. Image: Thunder over a lake - this forms the image of Guī Mèi. The superior man, in accordance with this, delays his marriage and awaits the proper time.

data.name: Statement_TheClinging
data.value: Lí: indicates that (under its conditions) it will be advantageous to persevere. Success depends on what is firm and correct. It will be advantageous to have the assistance of the great man. Decision: Lí means 'clinging' or 'attachment.' 'It will be advantageous to persevere' - (because) when one clings to what is right and proper, success will follow. 'Success depends on what is firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper conduct leads to favorable outcomes. 'It will be advantageous to have the assistance of the great man' - (because) wise guidance is needed when clinging to the right path. 'Care must be taken not to let the cow escape' - (because) vigilance is required to maintain what is good. Image: Fire clinging to wood - this forms the image of Lí. The superior man, in accordance with this, cultivates his brightness and makes his character brilliant.

data.name: Statement_TheWanderer
data.value: Lǚ: indicates that (under its conditions) the wanderer will be successful. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Lǚ means 'the wanderer.' 'The wanderer will be successful' - (because) when one travels with proper preparation and maintains correct principles, success will follow. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and adherence to moral principles are essential for the traveler. 'The wanderer's hostelry burns' - (because) carelessness leads to disaster. 'He loses his ox - there will be evil' - (because) losing what sustains one leads to misfortune. Image: Fire on a mountain - this forms the image of Lǚ. The superior man, in accordance with this, observes customs and ceremonies, and understands the principles of hospitality.

data.name: Statement_TheCauldron
data.value: Dǐng: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. Decision: Dǐng means 'the cauldron.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) the cauldron represents transformation and nourishment, essential for civilization. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) consistent effort in refining and improving oneself leads to success. 'The cauldron has golden ears and a bronze carrying-ring' - (because) proper tools and resources are needed for great undertakings. 'The cauldron turns upside down' - (because) improper use leads to failure. Image: Fire over wood - this forms the image of Dǐng. The superior man, in accordance with this, establishes his decrees and reforms his institutions.

data.name: Statement_BeforeCompletion
data.value: Wèi Jì: indicates progress and success (in the end). (But it is like) a young fox that has almost crossed the stream, (when) its tail gets immersed. There will be no advantage in any way. Decision: 'Wèi Jì indicates progress and success' – (because) the yielding (line, the sixth five) attains the central place. 'A young fox that has almost crossed the stream' – (shows it) has not yet escaped from danger (the center of the water). 'Its tail gets immersed. There will be no advantage' – (because it) cannot continue to the end. Although (the lines) are not in their correct positions, the strong and the weak (lines) respond to each other. Image: Fire above Water forms the image of Wèi Jì (Before Completion). The superior man, in accordance with this, carefully discriminates among things and arranges them in their proper places.

data.name: LineStatement_BeforeCompletion-1
data.value: He gets his tail immersed. Humiliation. Image: 'He gets his tail immersed' – (because) he does not know the proper limit (or: the extreme danger).

data.name: LineStatement_BeforeCompletion-2
data.value: He drags back his wheel. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: The second nine's 'perseverance brings good fortune' – (is because) acting from the central position leads to correctness.

data.name: LineStatement_BeforeCompletion-3
data.value: Before completion. To advance brings misfortune. (Yet) it is favorable to cross the great stream. Image: 'Before completion. To advance brings misfortune.' – (Because) the position is not appropriate.

data.name: LineStatement_BeforeCompletion-4
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. Regret vanishes. (With the vigor of) Thunder, he attacks the Gui Fang region. For three years (he fights), and is rewarded by the great country. Image: 'Perseverance brings good fortune. Regret vanishes.' – (For) the will is carried out.

data.name: LineStatement_BeforeCompletion-5
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. No regret. The light of the superior man (shines forth). He possesses sincerity and good faith. There will be good fortune. Image: 'The light of the superior man' – its brightness brings good fortune.

data.name: LineStatement_BeforeCompletion-6
data.value: He possesses sincerity and (thus can) drink wine. No blame. But if he wets his head (in it), (then) although he possesses sincerity, he loses the proper measure. Image: 'Drinking wine and wetting his head' – (shows) he also does not know moderation.

data.name: Statement_YouthfulFolly
data.value: Méng: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. What is not correct will not be advantageous. Decision: Méng means 'youthful folly' or 'inexperience.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) with proper guidance and education, ignorance can be transformed into wisdom. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles is essential for learning and growth. 'Not accepting discipline - there will be evil' - (because) refusing instruction leads to failure. 'Taking a wife - good fortune' - (because) proper relationships are fundamental to human development. Image: A spring wells up at the foot of a mountain - this forms the image of Méng. The superior man, in accordance with this, cultivates his character and develops his talents.

data.name: LineStatement_YouthfulFolly-1
data.value: He meets with his mate. They are both of the same character. There will be no blame. Image: 'He meets with his mate' – (because) corresponding (elements) are moved together.

data.name: LineStatement_YouthfulFolly-2
data.value: He meets his equal. There will be good fortune. Image: 'He meets his equal' – (because) he is in the central position.

data.name: LineStatement_YouthfulFolly-3
data.value: He separates himself from his associates. There will be no blame. Image: 'He separates himself from his associates' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: LineStatement_YouthfulFolly-4
data.value: He separates himself from his associates. There will be good fortune. Image: 'He separates himself from his associates' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: LineStatement_YouthfulFolly-5
data.value: He rightly obtains the praise (due to him), and in his dwelling-place there is good fortune. He has obtained the (right) position, and is free from anxiety. Image: 'He rightly obtains the praise (due to him)' – (because) he is in the central position, and is correct.

data.name: LineStatement_YouthfulFolly-6
data.value: He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage. He puts aside his (ornamental) vessels. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them. Image: 'He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage' – (because) his will is set on what is great.

data.name: Statement_Dispersion
data.value: Huàn: indicates that there will be progress and success. The king approaches his ancestral temple. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream (i.e., to embark on significant ventures). Advantage will be found in being firm and correct. Decision: Huàn indicates progress and success. (For) the strong (line, the second nine) comes (from the upper trigram) and is not exhausted (in the lower). The weak (line, the fourth six) gets its (proper) place without (the trigram), and (its subject) ascends to (the king, the fifth line, to) unite with him. 'The king approaches his ancestral temple' – the king (then) is in the (proper) central position. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' – (for he) embarking on wood (i.e., a boat) will achieve success. Image: The wind blows over the water – this forms the image of Huàn. The ancient kings, in accordance with this, presented offerings to the Lord of Heaven and established the ancestral temple.

data.name: LineStatement_Dispersion-1
data.value: He uses a strong horse for his rescue. Good fortune. Image: The good fortune of the first six – (comes from) docility.

data.name: LineStatement_Dispersion-2
data.value: Amidst dispersion, he hastens to his resting place. Regret vanishes. Image: 'Amidst dispersion, he hastens to his resting place' – (thus) he attains his desire (of security).

data.name: LineStatement_Dispersion-3
data.value: He dissipates his self (i.e., his personal concerns). There will be no regret. Image: 'He dissipates his self' – (for) his aim is directed outward (to the general good).

data.name: LineStatement_Dispersion-4
data.value: He dissipates the crowd (of his party). There will be great good fortune. He dissipates (them, and they gather) like a mound (of earth). This is not what ordinary men can think of. Image: 'He dissipates the crowd, (leading to) great good fortune' – (for his virtue) is great and brilliant.

data.name: LineStatement_Dispersion-5
data.value: His dissolving (influence is felt) like the great perspiration (that flows freely) when he issues his great proclamation. He dissipates (the wealth stored in) the royal palace (for the people's benefit). No blame. Image: 'No blame in dissipating the royal stores' – (for the king) is in the correct position.

data.name: LineStatement_Dispersion-6
data.value: He dissipates (the fear of) bloodshed, (causing it to) go away and be kept at a distance. No blame. Image: 'He dissipates the fear of bloodshed' – (thus) he keeps harm at a distance.

data.name: Statement_Conflict
data.value: Sòng: indicates that (though there is) sincerity (in the heart), it is obstructed. Being cautious and apprehensive (in the midst of contention) will bring good fortune in the end. (But) to carry the contention to the bitter end will bring misfortune. It is advantageous to see the great man (for judgment). It is not advantageous to cross the great stream (to venture into danger). Decision: In Sòng, we have strength above and danger below; (there is) danger (within) and strength (without) – hence contention. 'Sòng indicates that (though there is) sincerity, it is obstructed. Being cautious and apprehensive will bring good fortune in the end' – (because) the strong (line, the second nine) has come and is in the central position. '(But) to carry it to the bitter end will bring misfortune' – contention cannot lead to success. 'It is advantageous to see the great man' – (because) he honors what is central and correct. 'It is not advantageous to cross the great stream' – (for) one would fall into the abyss. Image: Heaven and water move in opposite directions – this forms the image of Sòng. The superior man, in accordance with this, in every undertaking takes thought about its beginning.

data.name: LineStatement_Conflict-1
data.value: He does not perpetuate the affair (of contention). There will be a little gossip. In the end, there will be good fortune. Image: 'He does not perpetuate the affair' – contention should not be prolonged. Although 'there is a little gossip,' the matter will be clearly discerned.

data.name: LineStatement_Conflict-2
data.value: He is unequal to the contention. He retires and flees (to avoid it). The people of his city (to the number of) three hundred households (remain undisturbed). There will be no calamity. Image: 'He is unequal to the contention; he retires and flees' – (for) from a lower position to contend with one above, calamity comes as if gathered (upon him).

data.name: LineStatement_Conflict-3
data.value: He feeds on old virtue (or: lives on his hereditary estate). Perseverance (in contention) brings danger. In the end, there will be good fortune. If he follows the king's service, he will not achieve success. Image: 'He feeds on old virtue' – following those above brings good fortune.

data.name: LineStatement_Conflict-4
data.value: He is unequal to the contention. He returns to (the acknowledgment of) Heaven's ordinance, changes (his attitude), and rests in perseverance. There will be good fortune. Image: 'He returns to the acknowledgment of Heaven's ordinance, changes and rests in perseverance' – he does not lose (what is proper).

data.name: LineStatement_Conflict-5
data.value: Contention. (But as the judge,) supremely auspicious. Image: 'Contention. Supremely auspicious.' – (Because he acts) from a central and correct position.

data.name: LineStatement_Conflict-6
data.value: (Even if) one were (by contention) to receive a leather belt (of office), by the end of the morning it will have been taken away from him three times. Image: 'To receive robes (of honor) through contention' – (shows one) is likewise not worthy of respect.

data.name: Statement_FellowshipWithMen
data.value: Tóng Rén: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in crossing the great stream. Decision: Tóng Rén means 'fellowship with men' or 'union with men.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when people unite with one heart and purpose, great achievements are possible. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles ensures lasting unity. 'There will be good fortune in crossing the great stream' - (because) collective effort can overcome great obstacles. 'The superior man discriminates between things and makes ready to attack the cities' - (because) even in unity, justice and discrimination are necessary. Image: Heaven above fire - this forms the image of Tóng Rén. The superior man, in accordance with this, distinguishes between things and makes ready to attack the cities.

data.name: LineStatement_FellowshipWithMen-1
data.value: Fellowship with men at the gate. There will be no fault. Image: 'Fellowship with men at the gate' - going out to associate with others, who can find fault with that?

data.name: LineStatement_FellowshipWithMen-2
data.value: Fellowship with men within his own clan. There will be evil (or disadvantage). Image: 'Fellowship with men within his own clan' - this is the path of disadvantage.

data.name: LineStatement_FellowshipWithMen-3
data.value: He hides his arms in the thick grass, and ascends the high hills. For three years he does not show himself. Image: 'He hides his arms in the thick grass' - he is opposed by the strong. 'For three years he does not show himself' - he is secure in his position.

data.name: LineStatement_FellowshipWithMen-4
data.value: He mounts the wall, but unable to attack. Good fortune. Image: 'He mounts the wall' - but by righteousness he cannot attack. The good fortune is due to his returning to the correct rule.

data.name: LineStatement_FellowshipWithMen-5
data.value: Men first weep and lament, but afterwards they laugh. Great armies are victorious, and they meet. Image: 'Men first weep and lament' - because they are central and correct. 'Great armies are victorious, and they meet' - means they overcome one another.

data.name: LineStatement_FellowshipWithMen-6
data.value: Fellowship with men in the suburbs. No regret. Image: 'Fellowship with men in the suburbs' - his will has not yet been realized.

data.name: Statement_TheArousing
data.value: Zhèn: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be success and progress. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Zhèn means 'the arousing' or 'excitation.' 'There will be success and progress' - (because) when action is taken with proper preparation and determination, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and adherence to moral principles are essential for effective action. 'Laughing and talking - good fortune' - (because) confidence and joy accompany proper action. 'Fear and trembling - misfortune' - (because) hesitation and fear lead to failure. Image: Thunder repeated - this forms the image of Zhèn. The superior man, in accordance with this, is fearful and apprehensive, cultivates virtue, and examines his character.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArousing-1
data.value: The shock comes - oh, oh! After it, laughing and talking - ha, ha! Good fortune. Image: 'The shock comes - oh, oh!' - fear leads to blessings. 'After it, laughing and talking - ha, ha!' - there will be rule thereafter.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArousing-2
data.value: The shock comes with danger. A hundred thousand times you lose your treasures. You climb the nine high hills. Do not pursue them. After seven days you will get them back. Image: 'The shock comes with danger' - because he is mounted on the strong.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArousing-3
data.value: The shock comes, and makes one uneasy. Though the shock moves one, there will be no error. Image: 'The shock comes, and makes one uneasy' - his position is not appropriate.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArousing-4
data.value: The shock plunges one in the mud. Image: 'The shock plunges one in the mud' - his light has not yet been displayed.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArousing-5
data.value: The shock comes, moving to and fro. Though there be danger, there will be no great loss. Something is to be done. Image: 'The shock comes, moving to and fro' - he walks in perilous paths. His affair is in the center, so there will be no great loss.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArousing-6
data.value: The shock comes, and makes one look about with fear and trembling. Going forward will be unfortunate. If the shock has not attacked oneself, but one's neighbor, there will be no blame. There will be discussion of matrimonial affairs. Image: 'The shock comes, and makes one look about with fear and trembling' - he has not obtained the middle position. Though the movement be unfortunate, there will be no blame, for he fears his neighbor and gives warning.

data.name: Statement_Enthusiasm
data.value: Yù: indicates that (under its conditions) it will be advantageous to set armies marching to chastise (the rebellious); and there will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. Decision: Yù means 'enthusiasm' or 'following with joy.' 'It will be advantageous to set armies marching' - (because) when people are united with enthusiasm and purpose, they can accomplish great things. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) genuine enthusiasm and unity lead to success wherever they are directed. 'Setting forth in accordance with orders' - (because) proper leadership and discipline are essential for collective action. Image: Thunder coming forth from the earth - this forms the image of Yù. The superior man, in accordance with this, establishes his ordinances and promulgates them among the people.

data.name: LineStatement_Enthusiasm-1
data.value: Boasting of enthusiasm. There will be evil. Image: 'Boasting of enthusiasm' - his will has reached its limit, and there will be evil.

data.name: LineStatement_Enthusiasm-2
data.value: Firm as a rock. He does not complete the day. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: 'He does not complete the day' - perseverance brings good fortune because he is central and correct.

data.name: LineStatement_Enthusiasm-3
data.value: Looking with eyes for enthusiasm. There will be regret. Delay brings regret. Image: 'Looking with eyes for enthusiasm' brings regret because his position is not appropriate.

data.name: LineStatement_Enthusiasm-4
data.value: The source of enthusiasm. He has great possessions. Do not doubt. Friends gather around him as hair clasps gather around the hairpin. Image: 'The source of enthusiasm' brings great possessions - his will is greatly carried out.

data.name: LineStatement_Enthusiasm-5
data.value: Persevering in what is sick. He constantly does not die. Image: The fifth line, 'persevering in what is sick' - because he is mounted on the strong. He constantly does not die - his central position has not perished.

data.name: LineStatement_Enthusiasm-6
data.value: Dark enthusiasm. Though accomplished, there will be change. No blame. Image: Dark enthusiasm is in the highest place - how can it be long continued?

data.name: Statement_Deliverance
data.value: Xiè: indicates that (in the case which it presupposes) there will be advantage in moving towards the southwest. If no (further) movement is made, coming back (to the old conditions) will be fortunate. If some movement must be made, doing it early will be fortunate. Decision: In Xiè we have (the trigram for) danger (坎) and that for movement. By movement one escapes the danger – hence it is called Liberation. 'Xiè indicates advantage in moving towards the southwest' – (because) going (there) will gain the multitude. 'Coming back will be fortunate' – (for) he thereby attains the central position (of rest). 'If some movement must be made, doing it early will be fortunate' – (for) going will achieve merit. When Heaven and Earth are set free, thunder and rain come forth. When thunder and rain come forth, the hundred fruits, grasses, and trees all burst their husks and sprouts. Great indeed is the significance of the time of Liberation! Image: Thunder and rain come forth – this forms the image of Xiè. The superior man, in accordance with this, pardons errors and forgives misdeeds.

data.name: LineStatement_Deliverance-1
data.value: No blame. Image: '(This is) at the border of the strong and the weak. In righteousness, there is no blame.'

data.name: LineStatement_Deliverance-2
data.value: In the field he catches three foxes and obtains a yellow (golden) arrowhead. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: 'The good fortune of the second nine through perseverance' – (comes from) attaining the central path.

data.name: LineStatement_Deliverance-3
data.value: A man carrying a (burden) on his back, and yet riding in a carriage – (such behavior) invites robbers to come. However firm and correct he may (try to) be, there will be cause for regret. Image: 'Carrying on the back and yet riding' – is also a thing to be ashamed of. 'He himself invites the robbers' – whom should one blame?

data.name: LineStatement_Deliverance-4
data.value: Deliver yourself from your (great) toe (i.e., from inferior companions). Then friends will come, and you will be trusted. Image: 'Deliver yourself from your toe' – (because the line) is not in its appropriate place.

data.name: LineStatement_Deliverance-5
data.value: Only the superior man can (effect) the deliverance (of the country). There will be good fortune. (He uses his) sincerity towards small men (as well). Image: 'The superior man effects the deliverance' – (and then) small men retire (of themselves).

data.name: LineStatement_Deliverance-6
data.value: A prince (with his bow) shoots a falcon on the top of a high wall. He gets it. Everything is advantageous. Image: 'The prince shoots the falcon' – thereby removing (the cause of) rebellion.

data.name: Statement_Duration
data.value: Héng: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be no error. Decision: Héng means 'duration' or 'permanence.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when principles and purposes are maintained consistently, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and adherence to moral principles are essential for lasting achievement. 'There will be no error' - (because) proper conduct sustained over time leads to correctness. 'The noble man abides in virtue and accumulates excellence' - (because) continuous cultivation of virtue leads to greatness. Image: Thunder and wind - this forms the image of Héng. The superior man, in accordance with this, stands firm and does not change his purpose.

data.name: LineStatement_Duration-1
data.value: If one deepen the duration (too much). There will be evil. No advantage in any movement. Image: The evil of deepening duration - because he seeks for depth at the beginning.

data.name: LineStatement_Duration-2
data.value: Regret disappears. Image: The second nine, 'regret disappears' - because he can maintain his central position.

data.name: LineStatement_Duration-3
data.value: He does not maintain his virtue with constancy. He will incur disgrace. Perseverance will be disadvantageous. Image: 'He does not maintain his virtue' - he cannot be contained anywhere.

data.name: LineStatement_Duration-4
data.value: In the field there are no game. Image: Being long in a position that is not his - how can he get game?

data.name: LineStatement_Duration-5
data.value: He maintains his virtue with constancy. Perseverance. For a woman, good fortune. For a man, evil. Image: For a woman perseverance brings good fortune - because she follows one to the end. For a man to make righteousness his rule - following a woman brings evil.

data.name: LineStatement_Duration-6
data.value: He shakes his duration. Evil. Image: Shaking the duration in the highest place - great without merit.

data.name: Statement_PushingUpward
data.value: Shēng: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Shēng means 'pushing upward' or 'ascending.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when one progresses steadily and persistently, advancement follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and adherence to moral principles are essential for true advancement. 'The great prince will present offerings to the ancestral temple' - (because) proper reverence and ceremony are part of upward progress. 'It will be advantageous to see the great man' - (because) wise guidance is needed for proper advancement. Image: Within the earth grows a tree - this forms the image of Shēng. The superior man, in accordance with this, accumulates goodness and enlarges his virtue.

data.name: LineStatement_PushingUpward-1
data.value: He pushes upward with sincerity. Great good fortune. Image: 'He pushes upward with sincerity' brings great good fortune - his will is in harmony with those above.

data.name: LineStatement_PushingUpward-2
data.value: Sincerity makes it advantageous to use a small sacrifice. No blame. Image: The sincerity of the second nine - there will be good fortune.

data.name: LineStatement_PushingUpward-3
data.value: He pushes upward into an empty city. Image: 'He pushes upward into an empty city' - there is nothing to cause doubt.

data.name: LineStatement_PushingUpward-4
data.value: The king makes an offering on Mount Qi. Good fortune. No blame. Image: 'The king makes an offering on Mount Qi' - he acts in accordance with the proper ceremony.

data.name: LineStatement_PushingUpward-5
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. He pushes upward by steps. Image: 'Perseverance brings good fortune, pushing upward by steps' - his will is greatly fulfilled.

data.name: LineStatement_PushingUpward-6
data.value: He pushes upward in darkness. It will be advantageous to be persevering and ceaseless. Image: Pushing upward in darkness at the top - leads to decrease and not to wealth.

data.name: Statement_TheWell
data.value: Jǐng: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be success. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Jǐng means 'the well.' 'There will be success' - (because) when resources are properly maintained and shared, they benefit all. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) well-maintained resources enable great undertakings. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) proper maintenance and use of resources require constancy and correctness. 'The town may be changed, but the well cannot be changed' - (because) fundamental resources and principles remain constant. 'The well is clean and bright' - (because) proper care ensures purity and usefulness. Image: Water over wood - this forms the image of Jǐng. The superior man, in accordance with this, comforts the people and encourages them to help one another.

data.name: LineStatement_TheWell-1
data.value: One does not drink the mud from the well. No animals come to an old well. Image: 'One does not drink the mud from the well' - because the well is abandoned and without water.

data.name: LineStatement_TheWell-2
data.value: At the mouth of the well, fish and turtles are shot. The jar is broken and leaks. Image: 'At the mouth of the well, fish and turtles are shot' - because the well is not properly maintained.

data.name: LineStatement_TheWell-3
data.value: The well is cleaned, but not used. My heart is sad, for one could draw from it. If the king were enlightened, we would all receive blessings. Image: 'The well is cleaned, but not used' - because there is sorrow that the well's potential is wasted.

data.name: LineStatement_TheWell-4
data.value: The well is lined with bricks. No blame. Image: 'The well is lined with bricks' - because repairs are being made.

data.name: LineStatement_TheWell-5
data.value: The well has clear, cold water from a clear spring. It is drinkable. Image: 'The well has clear, cold water' - because its central and correct position provides pure sustenance.

data.name: LineStatement_TheWell-6
data.value: One draws from the well without hindrance. It has true confidence. There will be supreme good fortune. Image: 'One draws from the well without hindrance' - because its achievements are great and complete.

data.name: Statement_PreponderanceOfTheGreat
data.value: Dà Guò: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. But it will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Dà Guò means 'preponderance of the great' or 'great excess.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when extraordinary measures are needed, bold action can lead to success. 'But it will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) even in times of excess, moral principles must be maintained. 'The ridge-pole sags' - (because) when the load is too great, support systems fail. 'The willow is bent' - (because) flexibility is needed to handle extraordinary situations. Image: The lake has risen above the trees - this forms the image of Dà Guò. The superior man, in accordance with this, stands aloof from the world and keeps his virtue free from stain.

data.name: LineStatement_PreponderanceOfTheGreat-1
data.value: One must spread white rushes beneath the mat. There will be no blame. Image: 'One must spread white rushes beneath the mat' - because he prepares carefully for the great burden.

data.name: LineStatement_PreponderanceOfTheGreat-2
data.value: A withered poplar sprouts. An old man gets a young wife. Everything is favorable. Image: 'A withered poplar sprouts' - because the old and young are in harmony.

data.name: LineStatement_PreponderanceOfTheGreat-3
data.value: The ridge-beam is bent. There will be evil. Image: 'The ridge-beam is bent' - because there is no one to help bear the burden.

data.name: LineStatement_PreponderanceOfTheGreat-4
data.value: The ridge-beam is majestic. Good fortune. There will be great blessing. Image: 'The ridge-beam is majestic' - because it is strong and cannot be broken.

data.name: LineStatement_PreponderanceOfTheGreat-5
data.value: A withered poplar puts forth flowers. An old woman gets a husband. No blame, no praise. Image: 'A withered poplar puts forth flowers' - because this is a weak foundation for bearing fruit.

data.name: LineStatement_PreponderanceOfTheGreat-6
data.value: One must wade through the water, which reaches the head. Danger, but no blame. Image: 'One must wade through the water' - because he is exhausted but cannot be harmed.

data.name: Statement_Following
data.value: Suí: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be no error. Decision: Suí means 'following.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when one follows the right path and proper leadership, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles is essential even in following others. 'There will be no error' - (because) proper following leads to correctness. 'The official receives his badge' - (because) proper recognition comes to those who follow correctly. 'He meets with bad luck in the western quarter' - (because) following the wrong path leads to misfortune. Image: Thunder in the midst of a lake - this forms the image of Suí. The superior man, in accordance with this, goes to see the great man at the proper time.

data.name: LineStatement_Following-1
data.value: The official receives his badge of office. There will be good fortune. Going out to meet with others brings success. Image: 'The official receives his badge of office' - because he follows the correct path and obtains recognition.

data.name: LineStatement_Following-2
data.value: He follows what is tied to him, but loses the stronger man. There will be evil. Image: 'He follows what is tied to him' - because he cannot serve both the weak and the strong.

data.name: LineStatement_Following-3
data.value: Following what is tied to him. To persevere will be evil. To maintain wealth will bring evil, but if one uses correctness in dealing with it, there will be good fortune. Image: 'Following what is tied to him' - there is shame in leaving the proper course.

data.name: LineStatement_Following-4
data.value: Following and obtaining. Perseverance will be evil. But if one uses correctness in dealing with it, there will be good fortune. Holding to the brightness of the understanding. Image: 'Following and obtaining' - because his will is set on the brightness of understanding.

data.name: LineStatement_Following-5
data.value: Sincere attachment to excellence. Good fortune. Image: 'Sincere attachment to excellence' - because he holds to the middle course.

data.name: LineStatement_Following-6
data.value: Tied and detained, thus he follows. The king uses him for sacrifice on the western mountain. Image: 'Tied and detained, thus he follows' - because he is at the top and exhausted.

data.name: Statement_TheGentle
data.value: Xùn: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be success and progress. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. Decision: Xùn means 'the gentle' or 'penetration.' 'There will be success and progress' - (because) gentle but persistent action can penetrate and influence even the hardest substances. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and moral principles are essential for effective gentle action. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) gentle persistence leads to success in all endeavors. 'Repeated compliance brings humiliation' - (because) excessive yielding without principle leads to degradation. Image: Wind following wind - this forms the image of Xùn. The superior man, in accordance with this, administers his commands and carries out his undertakings.

data.name: LineStatement_TheGentle-1
data.value: Advancing and retreating. Perseverance of a military man will be advantageous. Image: 'Advancing and retreating' - because the will is in doubt. 'Perseverance of a military man' - because the will is set on bringing order.

data.name: LineStatement_TheGentle-2
data.value: Gentleness under the bed. Employing shamans and wizards in multitudes. Good fortune, no blame. Image: 'The good fortune of employing multitudes of shamans and wizards' - because he has obtained the middle course.

data.name: LineStatement_TheGentle-3
data.value: Repeated gentleness. Humiliation. Image: The humiliation of 'repeated gentleness' - because the will is exhausted.

data.name: LineStatement_TheGentle-4
data.value: Remorse disappears. Taking the field, three kinds of game are obtained. Image: 'Taking the field and getting three kinds of game' - because he has done what is right.

data.name: LineStatement_TheGentle-5
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. Remorse disappears. No disadvantage. Being at first without constant, but at last with constant. First for three days, then for three days. Good fortune. Image: 'Perseverance brings good fortune and remorse disappears' - because he is in the central and correct position.

data.name: LineStatement_TheGentle-6
data.value: Gentleness under the bed. Losing his property and axe. Perseverance will be evil. Image: 'Gentleness under the bed' - because he is at the top and exhausted. 'Losing his property and axe' - though correct, it is evil.

data.name: Statement_TheTamingPowerOfTheSmall
data.value: Xiǎo Chù: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune. Decision: Xiǎo Chù means 'the taming power of the small.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when small forces are properly applied with persistence, they can achieve significant results. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and moral principles are essential for effective action. 'There will be good fortune' - (because) proper application of gentle but persistent force leads to favorable outcomes. 'The wind drives away the clouds' - (because) gentle but consistent action can disperse obstacles. Image: Wind blowing over heaven - this forms the image of Xiǎo Chù. The superior man, in accordance with this, refines his manners and nourishes his virtue.

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheSmall-1
data.value: Returning from the path. How can there be blame? Good fortune. Image: 'Returning from the path' - his course is correct and advantageous.

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheSmall-2
data.value: The restraints one draws are like the leather thong of a chariot. He perseveres. Image: 'The restraints one draws are like the leather thong of a chariot' - because he is central and correct.

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheSmall-3
data.value: Seeing a husband turning back his carriage. To persevere will be dangerous. Like a strip of bacon. To go on will be disgrace, but no blame. Image: 'The husband turning back his carriage' - position is not appropriate.

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheSmall-4
data.value: The truth and sincerity of the restraints. Blood will flow. Fear and alarm are at their height. There will be no blame. Image: 'The truth and sincerity of the restraints' - because he has help.

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheSmall-5
data.value: The rich and affectionate restraint. He neighbors enrich him. Being at first without constant, but at last with constant. Image: 'The rich and affectionate restraint' - because he is central and correct.

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheSmall-6
data.value: The restraints come from heaven. Perseverance will be evil. No advantage. Image: 'The restraints come from heaven' - though his will is set on restraint, it leads to evil.

data.name: Statement_TheFamily
data.value: Jiā Rén: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be good fortune. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Jiā Rén means 'the family' or 'relations within the home.' 'There will be good fortune' - (because) when family relationships are properly ordered, harmony and prosperity follow. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper roles within the family leads to success. 'The wife and children are firm and correct' - (because) proper conduct within the family creates a stable foundation. 'The father exercises authority' - (because) proper leadership within the family ensures order and harmony. Image: Wind comes forth from fire - this forms the image of Jiā Rén. The superior man, in accordance with this, speaks with gravity and deliberation, and cultivates his character.

data.name: LineStatement_TheFamily-1
data.value: Establish order within the family. Regret disappears. Image: 'Establish order within the family' - because one's will is directed toward correcting relationships.

data.name: LineStatement_TheFamily-2
data.value: There is no need to go outside the family. Persistence brings good fortune. Image: 'There is no need to go outside the family' - because the proper focus is on household matters.

data.name: LineStatement_TheFamily-3
data.value: When family members are severe, there will be regret and danger. But if there is harmony and discipline, good fortune. Image: 'When family members are severe' - because the position is not central, requiring balance.

data.name: LineStatement_TheFamily-4
data.value: Enrich the family. Great good fortune. Image: 'Enrich the family' - because harmony makes relationships prosperous.

data.name: LineStatement_TheFamily-5
data.value: The king approaches his family. Do not worry. Good fortune. Image: 'The king approaches his family' - because love and harmony bring mutual affection.

data.name: LineStatement_TheFamily-6
data.value: Be sincere and trustworthy. Good fortune in the end. Image: 'Be sincere and trustworthy' - because this principle establishes order throughout family.

data.name: Statement_Increase
data.value: Yì: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Yì means 'increase.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when resources are properly allocated and shared, growth and success follow. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) increased resources and capabilities enable great undertakings. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) proper allocation of resources requires moral principles and constancy. 'One makes offerings to the imperial ancestor' - (because) sharing benefits with others and honoring traditions are essential aspects of increase. Image: Wind over thunder - this forms the image of Yì. The superior man, in accordance with this, does not accumulate his wealth, but shares it with others.

data.name: LineStatement_Increase-1
data.value: It is advantageous to perform great deeds. Supreme good fortune. No blame. Image: 'It is advantageous to perform great deeds' - because help from below responds to the call.

data.name: LineStatement_Increase-2
data.value: One may increase and be faithful. Eternally persevering brings good fortune. The king uses this to offer sacrifice to God. Good fortune. Image: 'One may increase and be faithful' - because the will is set on eternal principles.

data.name: LineStatement_Increase-3
data.value: One increases and is met with sincere confidence. Use this to accomplish virtuous deeds. No blame. If one is truthful, one may use middle men and presents, but has no faith in their loyalty. Image: 'One increases and is met with sincere confidence' - because this is a way to express gratitude.

data.name: LineStatement_Increase-4
data.value: Follow the middle course and tell your plans to the ruler. He will follow you. Use this to move capital. Image: 'Follow the middle course and tell your plans' - because you act in harmony with those above.

data.name: LineStatement_Increase-5
data.value: Be sincere and have true confidence. Do not question. Supreme good fortune. Your sincerity will be blessed. Image: 'Be sincere and have true confidence' - because there is no need to ask about blessings.

data.name: LineStatement_Increase-6
data.value: No one adds to his increase. Some strike him. His heart is not constant. Misfortune. Image: 'No one adds to his increase' - because his position is exhausted and without help.

data.name: Statement_Innocence
data.value: Wú Wàng: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be success and progress. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. Decision: Wú Wàng means 'innocence' or 'freedom from false expectations.' 'There will be success and progress' - (because) when one acts with pure intentions and without ulterior motives, success follows naturally. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and honest action leads to favorable outcomes. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) innocent action with pure intentions can overcome great obstacles. 'If one does not cultivate his fields, he will have misfortune' - (because) neglecting one's duties leads to failure. Image: Thunder rolls beneath heaven - this forms the image of Wú Wàng. The superior man, in accordance with this, cultivates his character and maintains his integrity.

data.name: LineStatement_Innocence-1
data.value: Innocent action brings good fortune. Image: 'Innocent action brings good fortune' - because will follows correct path without deviation.

data.name: LineStatement_Innocence-2
data.value: If one does not count on the harvest when plowing, nor on the use of the field when cultivating it, it is favorable to undertake something. Image: 'If one does not count on the harvest' - because one is not thinking of gain.

data.name: LineStatement_Innocence-3
data.value: Following what is not proper brings misfortune. But if one maintains innocence, there will be no blame. Image: 'Following what is not proper brings misfortune' - because position is not central and proper.

data.name: LineStatement_Innocence-4
data.value: One can be innocent. Good fortune. Image: 'One can be innocent' - because one is in proper position and has support.

data.name: LineStatement_Innocence-5
data.value: One suffers from innocent illness. No medicine needed. Good fortune. Image: 'One suffers from innocent illness' - because innocence is maintained despite circumstances.

data.name: LineStatement_Innocence-6
data.value: Innocent action brings misfortune. No advantage in anything. Image: 'Innocent action brings misfortune' - because one is at the top and exhausted.

data.name: Statement_BitingThrough
data.value: Shì Kè: indicates successful progress. It will be advantageous to use legal constraints (or: to proceed with legal punishments). Decision: 'There is something between the jaws' – hence it is called Shì Kè (Biting Through). 'Biting through leads to success.' (For) the strong and the weak lines are clearly divided; there is movement and clarity. 'Thunder and lightning combine' to make things manifest. The yielding line attains the central place and moves upward. Although (the fifth line) is not in its correct (strong) position, 'it is advantageous to use legal constraints.' Image: Thunder and lightning together form the image of Shì Kè. The ancient kings, in accordance with this, clarified the penalties and made the laws clear (to all).

data.name: LineStatement_BitingThrough-1
data.value: Wearing foot-shackles that injure the toes. No blame. Image: 'Wearing foot-shackles that injure the toes' – (so that) he cannot walk (in wrong paths).

data.name: LineStatement_BitingThrough-2
data.value: Biting through tender skin and injuring the nose. No blame. Image: 'Biting through tender skin and injuring the nose' – (because this yielding line) rides on a strong line (the first nine).

data.name: LineStatement_BitingThrough-3
data.value: Biting through dried, tough meat and encountering poison. There is slight humiliation, but no blame. Image: 'Encountering poison' – (because) the position is not appropriate.

data.name: LineStatement_BitingThrough-4
data.value: Biting through dried gristly meat (with bone). He comes across a metal arrowhead. Perseverance in difficulty is advantageous. Good fortune. Image: 'Perseverance in difficulty is advantageous and leads to good fortune.' – (But the way is) not yet fully illuminated.

data.name: LineStatement_BitingThrough-5
data.value: Biting through dried meat. He obtains yellow gold (or: a golden arrowhead). Perseverance (even) in danger. No blame. Image: 'Perseverance in danger brings no blame.' – (Because his) actions are appropriate.

data.name: LineStatement_BitingThrough-6
data.value: Wearing a cangue that injures the ears. Misfortune. Image: 'Wearing a cangue that injures the ears' – (because) his hearing (and understanding) was not clear.

data.name: Statement_TheCornersOfTheMouth
data.value: Yí: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. Decision: Yí means 'the corners of the mouth' or 'the jaw.' 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) when one is nourished properly and maintains good relationships, success follows in all endeavors. 'The superior man takes his food and nourishment' - (because) proper sustenance and care are essential for well-being. 'Seeking nourishment through proper channels' - (because) obtaining what one needs through appropriate means leads to harmony. Image: Thunder and wind - this forms the image of Yí. The superior man, in accordance with this, is careful of his words and temperate in eating.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCornersOfTheMouth-1
data.value: You guard your jaws and are still. Good fortune. Image: 'You guard your jaws and are still' - because one knows to be content with little.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCornersOfTheMouth-2
data.value: You guard your jaws and are still. Misfortune. Image: 'You guard your jaws and are still' - because one retreats from the proper path.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCornersOfTheMouth-3
data.value: You guard your jaws but are not still. Misfortune. Image: 'You guard your jaws but are not still' - because one loses proper conduct.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCornersOfTheMouth-4
