data.value: You guard your jaws. Good fortune. The dripping nourishes. Image: 'You guard your jaws' - because one is in proper position. 'The dripping nourishes' - because it brings brilliance.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCornersOfTheMouth-5
data.value: You retreat from guarding your jaws. Good fortune. Image: 'You retreat from guarding your jaws' - because one is supported by central position.

data.name: LineStatement_TheCornersOfTheMouth-6
data.value: You guard your jaws and are still. Misfortune. Image: 'You guard your jaws and are still' - because one is at the top and without support.

data.name: Statement_WorkOnTheDecayed
data.value: Gǔ: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Gǔ means 'work on the decayed' or 'restoration.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one addresses problems and restores what has deteriorated, renewal and success follow. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) proper restoration efforts can overcome great challenges. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper methods are essential for effective restoration. 'The king approaches his ancestral temple' - (because) honoring traditions and restoring proper order are fundamental duties. Image: Wind beneath the mountain - this forms the image of Gǔ. The superior man, in accordance with this, encourages people and nurtures their character.

data.name: LineStatement_WorkOnTheDecayed-1
data.value: One's father is involved in setting things right. There will be advantage in removing what has decayed. If one undertakes this task, there will be good fortune. Image: 'One's father is involved in setting things right' - because the father is central and firm in his purpose.

data.name: LineStatement_WorkOnTheDecayed-2
data.value: One's mother is involved in setting things right. There will be no blame. Image: 'One's mother is involved in setting things right' - because she is central and yielding.

data.name: LineStatement_WorkOnTheDecayed-3
data.value: One's father has some remorse. There will be no small blame. Image: 'One's father has some remorse' - because the father is too strong.

data.name: LineStatement_WorkOnTheDecayed-4
data.value: One father is involved in continuing the work. There will be misfortune. Image: 'One father is involved in continuing the work' - because he goes beyond what is proper.

data.name: LineStatement_WorkOnTheDecayed-5
data.value: One's father uses transformation and praise. Good fortune. Image: 'One's father uses transformation and praise' - because one is central and correct.

data.name: LineStatement_WorkOnTheDecayed-6
data.value: One does not serve king. But there is advancement. Image: 'One does not serve king' - because one is at the top and exhausted.

data.name: Statement_TheAbysmal
data.value: Kǎn: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Kǎn means 'the abysmal' or 'water.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one faces difficulties with perseverance and proper conduct, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and constancy are essential for overcoming challenges. 'The water flows on uninterruptedly and reaches its goal' - (because) persistent effort and proper direction lead to success. 'The water fills up the holes and caverns' - (because) thoroughness and attention to detail are necessary for complete success. Image: Water flows on continuously - this forms the image of Kǎn. The superior man, in accordance with this, practices virtue and cultivates his character.

data.name: LineStatement_TheAbysmal-1
data.value: One falls into the abyss. Misfortune. Image: 'One falls into the abyss' - because one loses the proper way.

data.name: LineStatement_TheAbysmal-2
data.value: One seeks but obtains only small advantages. Image: 'One seeks but obtains only small advantages' - because one is in central position but still in danger.

data.name: LineStatement_TheAbysmal-3
data.value: One enters the abyss, both front and back. Danger, but one can use advantage. Image: 'One enters the abyss, both front and back' - because one is exhausted but still has some advantage.

data.name: LineStatement_TheAbysmal-4
data.value: One is filled with a sacrificial vessel of wine and food. Final good fortune. Image: 'One is filled with a sacrificial vessel' - because one chooses the correct position.

data.name: LineStatement_TheAbysmal-5
data.value: The abyss is not yet filled. Level and smooth. Good fortune. Image: 'The abyss is not yet filled' - because one is central and correct.

data.name: LineStatement_TheAbysmal-6
data.value: One is bound with cords and ropes. Misfortune for three years. Image: 'One is bound with cords and ropes' - because one loses the way and faces calamity.

data.name: Statement_Limitation
data.value: Jié: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. Decision: Jié means 'limitation' or 'restraint.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one knows and accepts proper limitations, success and harmony follow. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper boundaries leads to favorable outcomes. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) proper limitation enables effective action in all directions. 'Genuine sincerity can overcome the obstacle of timidity' - (because) honesty and authenticity can dispel fears. Image: Water over a lake - this forms the image of Jié. The superior man, in accordance with this, establishes his words and confirms his actions.

data.name: LineStatement_Limitation-1
data.value: One goes forth without leaving the gate. Misfortune. Image: 'One goes forth without leaving the gate' - because one leaves the proper path.

data.name: LineStatement_Limitation-2
data.value: One does not leave the gate. Misfortune. Image: 'One does not leave the gate' - because one is too rigid.

data.name: LineStatement_Limitation-3
data.value: One leaves no gate and has remorse. Misfortune. Image: 'One leaves no gate and has remorse' - because one is exhausted.

data.name: LineStatement_Limitation-4
data.value: One is content with limitation. Good fortune. Image: 'One is content with limitation' - because one is in correct position.

data.name: LineStatement_Limitation-5
data.value: Central limitation brings good fortune. Image: 'Central limitation brings good fortune' - because one is central and correct.

data.name: LineStatement_Limitation-6
data.value: Harsh limitation brings misfortune. Image: 'Harsh limitation brings misfortune' - because one is at the top and without guidance.

data.name: Statement_DifficultyAtTheBeginning
data.value: Zhūn: indicates that great progress and success (will follow). Advantage will be found in being firm and correct. Do not engage in active movement anywhere. It is advantageous to appoint feudal lords (to establish order). Decision: In Zhūn, we have the first intercourse of the strong (yang) and weak (yin) lines, and the consequent birth of difficulty. (We have the trigram indicating) movement in the midst of danger. Through great perseverance and correctness, there will be prosperity and success. (The action of) thunder and rain fills (the atmosphere). (This represents) the creative action of Heaven, when all was chaotic and obscure. It is the proper time for appointing feudal lords (to establish order), but there will be no rest (i.e., tranquility is not yet attained). Image: Clouds and thunder – this forms the image of Zhūn. The superior man, in accordance with this, weaves the threads of order (out of chaos).

data.name: LineStatement_DifficultyAtTheBeginning-1
data.value: Hesitating and wander (like a stone pillar). Advantageous to abide in perseverance. Advantageous to appoint feudal lords. Image: 'Though he hesitates and wander' – his will and action are correct. 'In his nobility, he descends to the lowly' – thereby he greatly wins the people.

data.name: LineStatement_DifficultyAtTheBeginning-2
data.value: Encircled and hampered, (as if) riding on horses that move in circles. (They are) not robbers, (but come) for marriage. The maiden is chaste and does not consent (to betrothal). After ten years, she then consents. Image Translation: 'The difficulty of the second six' – (arises from) riding on the strong (line). 'After ten years she then consents' – (for) things then return to their regular course.

data.name: LineStatement_DifficultyAtTheBeginning-3
data.value: (He who) pursues deer without a forester (as guide) only enters into the depths of the forest. The superior man, perceiving the subtle signs (of danger), thinks it better to give up the chase. To go forward will bring regret. Image: 'Pursuing deer without a forester' – (shows he) is following (only) the game. 'The superior man gives it up' – to go forward would lead to regret and exhaustion.

data.name: LineStatement_DifficultyAtTheBeginning-4
data.value: (Like one) riding on horses that move in circles, (yet if he go to) seek marriage, going forward will be fortunate. All will be advantageous. Image: '(Daring to) seek and go forward' – (shows his) intelligence.

data.name: LineStatement_DifficultyAtTheBeginning-5
data.value: The difficulty (is like that of one) whose stores of rich nourishment are blocked up. A small (and cautious) perseverance will bring good fortune; a great (and aggressive) perseverance will bring misfortune. Image: 'Stores of rich nourishment are blocked up' – (shows that) the grace (of the ruler) is not yet widely diffused.

data.name: LineStatement_DifficultyAtTheBeginning-6
data.value: (Like one) riding on horses that move in circles, (and) weeping tears of blood in continuous streams. Image: 'Weeping tears of blood in streams' – how can this state last long?

data.name: Statement_AfterCompletion
data.value: Jì Jì: indicates progress and success in small matters. There will be advantage in being firm and correct. There is good fortune in the beginning, but disorder may appear in the end. Decision: 'Jì Jì indicates progress and success' – that is, in small matters. 'There will be advantage in being firm and correct' – (for) the strong and the weak lines are in their correct places, each in its appropriate position. 'There is good fortune in the beginning' – (because) the weak (second line) is in the center. 'Disorder may appear in the end' – because the course (represented by the hexagram) has been exhausted. Image: Water over Fire forms the image of Jì Jì (After Completion). The superior man, in accordance with this, thinks of calamity and guards against it beforehand.

data.name: LineStatement_AfterCompletion-1
data.value: He drags back his wheel. He wets his tail. There will be no blame. Image: 'He drags back his wheel' – (this cautious attitude is) right, and therefore there is no blame.

data.name: LineStatement_AfterCompletion-2
data.value: The woman loses her carriage curtain. Do not pursue it. In seven days you will get it. Image: 'In seven days you will get it' – (because she adheres to) the central path (the Mean).

data.name: LineStatement_AfterCompletion-3
data.value: The Gao Zong (Emperor Wu Ding of Yin) attacked the Gui Fang region. After three years he conquered them. Small men should not be employed (in such tasks). Image: 'After three years he conquered them' – (the state is) wearied.

data.name: LineStatement_AfterCompletion-4
data.value: There are rags (needed) for padding leaks in the boat. Be on guard all day long. Image: 'Be on guard all day long' – (because there is) something to be feared (suspicion of danger).

data.name: LineStatement_AfterCompletion-5
data.value: The neighbor in the east who slaughters an ox (for sacrifice) does not equal the neighbor in the west with his simple offering, who truly receives the blessing. Image: 'The neighbor in the east who slaughters an ox is not equal to the neighbor in the west' – (because the latter's offering is) timely. 'He truly receives the blessing' – for great good fortune comes (to him).

data.name: LineStatement_AfterCompletion-6
data.value: He gets his head immersed (in the water). There is peril. Image: 'He gets his head immersed. There is peril.' – How can this last long?

data.name: Statement_Revolution
data.value: Gé: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. Decision: Gé means 'revolution' or 'change.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when change is properly timed and executed, renewal and success follow. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles ensures proper change. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) well-timed revolution leads to favorable outcomes. 'The great man brings about change at the proper time' - (because) wise leadership is essential for successful transformation. Image: Fire in the midst of water - this forms the image of Gé. The superior man, in accordance with this, sets his calendar in order and makes the seasons clear.

data.name: LineStatement_Revolution-1
data.value: One wraps oneself in oxhide. It is advantageous to persevere. Image: 'One wraps oneself in oxhide' - because the time is not yet ripe for change.

data.name: LineStatement_Revolution-2
data.value: One makes revolution on the day of spring. Going forward brings good fortune. No blame. Image: 'One makes revolution on the day of spring' - because one acts according to the season.

data.name: LineStatement_Revolution-3
data.value: Revolution brings misfortune. Perseverance brings danger. When revolution has been discussed three times, confidence is established. Image: 'Revolution brings misfortune' - because one acts recklessly without proper consideration.

data.name: LineStatement_Revolution-4
data.value: Remorse disappears. Confidence is established. Changing brings good fortune. Image: 'Remorse disappears' - because one has changed according to proper principles.

data.name: LineStatement_Revolution-5
data.value: The great man changes like a tiger. But before seizing, he has doubts. Image: 'The great man changes like a tiger' - because his transformation is awe-inspiring.

data.name: LineStatement_Revolution-6
data.value: The superior man changes like a leopard. Small men change their faces. Image: 'The superior man changes like a leopard' - because his transformation follows proper principles.

data.name: Statement_DarkeningOfTheLight
data.value: Míng Yí: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) it will be advantageous to realize the difficulty (of the position) and maintain firm correctness. Decision: The light (sun) has sunk into the earth: this is Míng Yí. (The hexagram teaches) one to keep his brilliant qualities concealed within and to maintain a submissive deportment without, thereby enduring great distress. King Wen (of Zhou) acted thus. 'It will be advantageous to realize the difficulty and maintain firm correctness' – (that is, one should) obscure his light (for the time being). Though involved in inner distress, to be able to correct his aim and hold it fast – the Viscount of Ji (Jizi) acted thus. Image: The light (sun) has sunk into the earth – this forms the image of Míng Yí. The superior man, in accordance with this, when dealing with the multitude, veils his brightness yet still remains luminous (in his governance).

data.name: LineStatement_DarkeningOfTheLight-1
data.value: The light is darkened as (a bird) in flight, (so that) it droops its wings. When the superior man (so) leaves (his place), for three days he eats nothing. Wherever he goes, the people there speak (ill of him). Image: 'When the superior man leaves, for three days he eats nothing' – in righteousness, he does not eat (the bread of the wicked).

data.name: LineStatement_DarkeningOfTheLight-2
data.value: The light is darkened, (as if) wounded in the left thigh. (But) one uses (the strength of) a strong horse to save himself. Good fortune. Image: The good fortune of the second six – (comes from) docility in accordance with rule.

data.name: LineStatement_DarkeningOfTheLight-3
data.value: The light is darkened, (as in) the case of hunting in the south (where the light is brightest) and taking the great chief (of darkness). (But) one must not be over-eager in his correctness. Image: 'The aim in hunting in the south' – is to achieve something great.

data.name: LineStatement_DarkeningOfTheLight-4
data.value: (He penetrates) into the left side of the belly (of the dark land). He gets at the very heart of the darkening of the light, and is able to leave the gate and courtyard (of the lord of darkness). Image: '(He penetrates) into the left side of the belly' – (and thus) gets at the (true) mind and thoughts (of the situation).

data.name: LineStatement_DarkeningOfTheLight-5
data.value: The darkening of the light as with Jizi. It is advantageous to maintain firm correctness. Image: 'The firm correctness of Jizi' – shows that the light (of intelligence and virtue) cannot be extinguished.

data.name: LineStatement_DarkeningOfTheLight-6
data.value: Not light but darkness. (He was) at first (like the sun) ascending to heaven; afterwards (he) plunged into the earth. Image: 'At first ascending to heaven' – (so as to) illuminate all the regions. 'Afterwards plunging into the earth' – (because he) lost the proper rule (of conduct).

data.name: Statement_TheArmy
data.value: Shī: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. Let the eldest son direct the army. Decision: Shī means 'the army' or 'multitude.' 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) when an army is properly led and disciplined, success follows in all endeavors. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) a well-led army can overcome great obstacles. 'Let the eldest son direct the army' - (because) proper leadership and authority are essential for military success. 'The host answers to the orders issued' - (because) discipline and obedience are fundamental to military effectiveness. Image: Water over the earth - this forms the image of Shī. The superior man, in accordance with this, tolerates differences and nurtures the multitudes.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArmy-1
data.value: The army should set forth in accordance with the rules. If not, there will be misfortune. Image: 'The army should set forth in accordance with the rules' - because discipline is essential.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArmy-2
data.value: One is in the midst of the army. Misfortune. No blame. Image: 'One is in the midst of the army' - because one has taken central position but still faces danger.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArmy-3
data.value: One may encounter misfortune in the army. But there will be no blame. Image: 'One may encounter misfortune in the army' - because one's position is not ideal.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArmy-4
data.value: One retreats from the army. Good fortune. Image: 'One retreats from the army' - because one is not attached to position.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArmy-5
data.value: There are wild beasts in the field. Good fortune in hunting. Image: 'There are wild beasts in the field' - because central position brings advantage.

data.name: LineStatement_TheArmy-6
data.value: The great prince issues commands and establishes states. Small men should not be employed. Image: 'The great prince issues commands' - because his authority comes from proper position.

data.name: Statement_KeepingStill
data.value: Biān: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Biān means 'keeping still' or 'mountain.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one knows when to remain still and when to act, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper timing are essential for success. 'Keeping his back still' - (because) knowing when to withdraw and remain inactive is wisdom. 'He does not serve his own interest' - (because) selflessness and proper perspective lead to greater achievements. Image: Mountains standing close together - this forms the image of Biān. The superior man, in accordance with this, keeps his thoughts retired and does not allow himself to be disturbed.

data.name: LineStatement_KeepingStill-1
data.value: Keeping his toes still. No blame. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: 'Keeping his toes still' - because he stops at the beginning, thus preserving his purity.

data.name: LineStatement_KeepingStill-2
data.value: Keeping his calves still. No blame. Unable to help (those whom he would follow). His heart is not glad. Image: 'Keeping his calves still' - because he does not keep his heart (in proper control).

data.name: LineStatement_KeepingStill-3
data.value: Keeping his loins still. There will be suffocation in his breathing. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: 'Keeping his loins still' - because the urgency (of the situation) is dangerous.

data.name: LineStatement_KeepingStill-4
data.value: Keeping his trunk still. No blame. Image: 'Keeping his trunk still' - because he is correct (in his position).

data.name: LineStatement_KeepingStill-5
data.value: Keeping his jawbones still. His words are orderly. Perseverance brings good fortune. There will be remorse (at first), but in the end good fortune. Image: 'Keeping his jawbones still' - because he is in the central (position) and correct.

data.name: LineStatement_KeepingStill-6
data.value: Keeping still with (benign) sincerity. There will be good fortune. Image: The good fortune of 'keeping still with sincerity' - comes from the thickness (of his virtue).

data.name: Statement_Grace
data.value: Bì: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Bì means 'grace' or 'embellishment.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one adorns and improves what is appropriate, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) proper embellishment must be grounded in moral principles and correctness. 'The king approaches his ancestral temple' - (because) proper ceremony and adornment honor traditions. 'He presents his productions to the Son of Heaven' - (because) offering one's best work with proper presentation leads to recognition. Image: Fire at the foot of the mountain - this forms the image of Bì. The superior man, in accordance with this, refines his manners and embellishes his character.

data.name: LineStatement_Grace-1
data.value: He adorns his toes. He leaves his carriage and walks. Image: 'He adorns his toes' - because the purpose (of his action) is proper.

data.name: LineStatement_Grace-2
data.value: He adorns his beard. Image: 'He adorns his beard' - because he follows (the one above) to whom he is attached.

data.name: LineStatement_Grace-3
data.value: Graceful and moist. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: 'Graceful and moist' - because he is correct (in his position) and obtains what he desires.

data.name: LineStatement_Grace-4
data.value: Grace or simplicity? A white horse comes as if on wings. He is not a robber, but will woo at the right time. Image: The top and bottom lines move in harmony. This is not a case of robbery.

data.name: LineStatement_Grace-5
data.value: Grace in the hills and gardens. He rolls his silks. A little humiliation brings good fortune. Image: The good fortune of the fifth five comes from the joy (in the gifts).

data.name: LineStatement_Grace-6
data.value: White grace. No blame. Image: 'White grace' - because he is at the top, and obtains the place of his desire.

data.name: Statement_TheTamingPowerOfTheGreat
data.value: Dà Chù: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. Decision: Dà Chù means 'the taming power of the great.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when great forces are properly directed and controlled, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) proper control of great power requires moral principles and constancy. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) well-directed great power leads to favorable outcomes. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) properly controlled great power can overcome great obstacles. Image: Heaven within the mountain - this forms the image of Dà Chù. The superior man, in accordance with this, acquaints himself with many sayings of antiquity and many deeds of the past.

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheGreat-1
data.value: Danger is at hand. It will be advantageous to stop. Image: 'Danger is at hand' - because the danger is not yet past.

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheGreat-2
data.value: The axletrees are taken from the carriage. Image: 'The axletrees are taken from the carriage' - because he is in the central (position) and does not lose himself.

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheGreat-3
data.value: The good horse is pursued, but it is difficult to get it. Advantage will be found in the practice of defensive warfare. There will be good fortune. Image: 'The practice of defensive warfare' - because he is following what is proper.

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheGreat-4
data.value: The board of the young bull. Great good fortune. Image: The good fortune of the fourth six comes from her being cheerful (in her taming).

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheGreat-5
data.value: The tusk of the gelded boar. Good fortune. Image: The good fortune of the fifth nine comes from having the reward (of his position).

data.name: LineStatement_TheTamingPowerOfTheGreat-6
data.value: He attains the way of heaven. Good fortune. Image: The good fortune of 'attaining the way of heaven' comes from his fulfilling his great purpose.

data.name: Statement_Decrease
data.value: Sǔn: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be prosperity and success. There will be no error. What is firm and correct may be maintained. Advantage will be found in every movement that shall be made. In what way can this be exemplified? (Even) with two baskets of simple offerings (presented with sincerity), there may be an approach (to the spirit of Heaven). Decision: In Sǔn, we have the diminution of what is below (to increase) what is above; the way (of the lower trigram) is directed upward. 'Diminution with sincerity brings supreme good fortune, no error, firm correctness, and advantage in movement.' 'How is this exemplified? Two baskets may be used in the sacrifice.' The use of two baskets must be at the proper time. Diminishing the firm and increasing the yielding must take place at the proper time. The processes of decrease and increase, of fullness and emptiness, go on in correspondence with the conditions of the time. Image: At the foot of the mountain lies the lake – this forms the image of Sǔn. The superior man, in accordance with this, restrains his wrath and curbs his desires.

data.name: LineStatement_Decrease-1
data.value: He suspends his own affairs and quickly goes (to help). No blame. But let him consider how to diminish (himself appropriately). Image: 'He suspends his affairs and quickly goes' – (for) he esteems the harmonizing of wills (above his own affairs).

data.name: LineStatement_Decrease-2
data.value: It is advantageous to maintain firm correctness. To advance brings misfortune. (In this case,) he should neither diminish nor increase (anything). Image: 'It is advantageous for the second nine to maintain firm correctness' – (for) he makes the central position his aim.

data.name: LineStatement_Decrease-3
data.value: When three men walk together, their number is diminished by one. When one man walks alone, he finds a companion. Image: 'When one man walks alone' – (but) with three, doubt arises.

data.name: LineStatement_Decrease-4
data.value: He diminishes his ailment (or fault). He makes it quickly go and there is joy. No blame. Image: 'He diminishes his ailment' – (this) also is a thing to be glad for.

data.name: LineStatement_Decrease-5
data.value: (If) someone (were to) increase him with (the precious gift of) ten pairs of tortoise shells (whose value could not be resisted), he could not refuse it. There will be supreme good fortune. Image: 'The supreme good fortune of the sixth five' – comes from the blessing of Heaven above.

data.name: LineStatement_Decrease-6
data.value: He does not diminish (others) but increases them. No blame. Perseverance brings good fortune. Advantage in every movement. (He) gets servants, but not for his own family (but for the public good). Image: 'He does not diminish but increases' – (thus) his great aim is attained.

data.name: Statement_Opposition
data.value: Lí: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) it will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. What is firm and correct may be maintained. Decision: Lí means 'opposition' or 'fire.' 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) when one maintains proper principles despite opposition, success follows. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) adherence to correct principles leads to favorable outcomes regardless of circumstances. 'What is firm and correct may be maintained' - (because) truth and virtue endure despite external challenges. Image: Fire clinging to fire - this forms the image of Lí. The superior man, in accordance with this, cultivates his brightness and makes his character brilliant.

data.name: LineStatement_Opposition-1
data.value: Remorse disappears. If you lose your horse, do not pursue it. It will return of its own accord. If you see evil people, guard against blame. Image: 'If you see evil people' - because you are avoiding their fault.

data.name: LineStatement_Opposition-2
data.value: You meet your master in a narrow street. No blame. Image: 'You meet your master in a narrow street' - because you have not gone against your proper course.

data.name: LineStatement_Opposition-3
data.value: You see your master in a carriage. There is no blame. But you are seized. This is unfortunate. Image: 'You see your master in a carriage' - because you are not at peace (with yourself).

data.name: LineStatement_Opposition-4
data.value: Remorse disappears. You meet your master, though you are separated. There is danger, but no blame. Image: 'You meet your master, though you are separated' - because your will is set on union.

data.name: LineStatement_Opposition-5
data.value: Remorse disappears. You eat what was hunted in the pit. What are you doing? The road is difficult. Image: 'You eat what was hunted in the pit' - because you are not in the proper position.

data.name: LineStatement_Opposition-6
data.value: Remorse disappears. You see your master dragging a sack. It is not robbery. He is looking for what he has lost. Image: The dragging of the sack - because he is at the top. He has not yet attained his purpose.

data.name: Statement_Treading
data.value: Lǚ: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Lǚ means 'treading' or 'conduct.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one treads the proper path with correct conduct, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper behavior are essential for success. 'Treading with the tail in the water' - (because) proceeding cautiously and humbly leads to safety. 'The king pronounces his mandates' - (because) proper conduct and clear communication are fundamental to leadership. Image: Heaven above the lake - this forms the image of Lǚ. The superior man, in accordance with this, discriminates between high and low and establishes the course of superior men.

data.name: LineStatement_Treading-1
data.value: Treading with simple conduct. No blame. Image: 'Treading with simple conduct' - because he is following the proper path.

data.name: LineStatement_Treading-2
data.value: Treading a smooth, level path. Perseverance of a dark man brings good fortune. Image: The good fortune of 'treading a smooth path' - because he is in the central position.

data.name: LineStatement_Treading-3
data.value: A one-eyed man is able to see, a lame man is able to tread. He treads on the tail of the tiger. The tiger bites the man. Misfortune. A warrior acts as a great ruler. Image: 'A one-eyed man is able to see' - this is not enough to see clearly.

data.name: LineStatement_Treading-4
data.value: He treads on the tail of the tiger. He becomes anxious and fearful. In the end, there will be good fortune. Image: The anxiety and fear - because he is in the proper position.

data.name: LineStatement_Treading-5
data.value: Resolute treading. Perseverance with awareness of danger brings good fortune. Image: The good fortune of 'resolute treading' - because he is in the central position and correct.

data.name: LineStatement_Treading-6
data.value: Look at your conduct, and consider the signs of good fortune. There will be supreme good fortune. Image: The supreme good fortune of the top line - because his achievement is complete.

data.name: Statement_InnerTruth
data.value: Zhōng Fú: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. Decision: Zhōng Fú means 'inner truth' or 'sincerity.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one acts with genuine sincerity and inner truth, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and honest conduct are essential for success. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) sincere action leads to favorable outcomes. 'The cry of the cock announces the dawn' - (because) genuine sincerity spreads and influences others. Image: Wind over wind - this forms the image of Zhōng Fú. The superior man, in accordance with this, deliberates about his words and confirms his actions.

data.name: LineStatement_InnerTruth-1
data.value: Being prepared brings good fortune. If there are sincerity and (others) are not yet convinced, there will be peace and stillness. Image: 'Being prepared brings good fortune' - because his will is not yet affected (by others).

data.name: LineStatement_InnerTruth-2
data.value: The crane cries in the shade. Her young ones respond to her. I have a good goblet, and I will share it with you. Image: Her young ones respond to her - because they share the same will.

data.name: LineStatement_InnerTruth-3
data.value: He finds a comrade. He strikes the drum, but then ceases. He weeps, but then sings. Image: The position of the third six is not suitable (for striking or weeping).

data.name: LineStatement_InnerTruth-4
data.value: The moon nearly full. A team of horses falls. No blame. Image: The position of the fourth six is not suitable (for the team of horses).

data.name: LineStatement_InnerTruth-5
data.value: He possesses sincerity, and is uniting (others). No blame. Image: The fifth nine possesses sincerity and is uniting others - because his position is correct and central.

data.name: LineStatement_InnerTruth-6
data.value: The cock's voice rises to heaven. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: The cock's voice rises to heaven - how can it remain long?

data.name: Statement_Development
data.value: Jiàn: indicates that (in the case which it presupposes) the maiden will be given in marriage. There will be good fortune. Advantage will be found in being firm and correct. Decision: The progress in Jiàn is like the (happy) marriage of a maiden. 'Advancing and attaining one's proper position' – going forward will achieve merit. Advancing by the correct path can set the state in order. (The fifth line) is in its position, the strong (line) having gained the central (place). (The hexagram indicates) stopping (艮) and (then) penetrating – movement that is not exhausted. Image: On the mountain, there is a tree – this forms the image of Jiàn. The superior man, in accordance with this, dwells in worthy virtue and improves the manners (and morals) of the people.

data.name: LineStatement_Development-1
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the riverbank. For a young man (in such a position), there is peril. There will be criticism. No blame. Image: 'The peril for the young man' – (yet) in principle, there is no blame.

data.name: LineStatement_Development-2
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the large, flat rock. (It finds) food and drink, and is at ease and content. There will be good fortune. Image: 'Food and drink, and contentment' – (he does not enjoy his meal) in vain (i.e., he deserves it).

data.name: LineStatement_Development-3
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the dry, flat land. The husband goes to war and does not return; the wife is pregnant but does not rear the child. There is misfortune. (Yet) it is advantageous to resist invaders. Image: 'The husband goes to war and does not return' – (he) is separated from his kind. 'The wife is pregnant but does not rear the child' – (she) has lost the proper way. 'Advantageous to resist invaders' – (for by uniting) they protect each other in obedience (to the situation).

data.name: LineStatement_Development-4
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the trees. It may alight on the flat branches (that can support it). No blame. Image: 'It may alight on the flat branches' – (by being) docile and adaptable.

data.name: LineStatement_Development-5
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the high hill. (Like) a wife who for three years does not conceive, (but) in the end, nothing can overcome her (constancy). There will be good fortune. Image: 'In the end, nothing can overcome her, (leading to) good fortune' – (for she) attains her desire.

data.name: LineStatement_Development-6
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the (high, level) plateau. Its feathers can be used for (the ornaments of) ceremonial rites. There will be good fortune. Image: 'Its feathers can be used for ceremonial rites, (leading to) good fortune' – (for this order) cannot be disturbed.

data.name: Statement_TheReceptive
data.value: Kūn: what is great and originating, penetrating, advantageous, correct and firm. Decision: The Judgment on the Decision says: Kūn is characterized by great completeness, and corresponds to the utmost in flexibility. Its attributes are docility, capacity for endurance, and freedom from prejudice. It is the complement of Qian (Heaven). The superior man, in accordance with this, cultivates his character and brings his talents into action. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them. Image: The earth's condition is receptive devotion - thus the superior man who has breadth of character carries the outer world.

data.name: LineStatement_TheReceptive-1
data.value: When hoar-frost is underfoot, solid ice is not far off. Image: 'Hoar-frost underfoot, solid ice not far off' - the cold air begins to congeal, leading to solid ice.

data.name: LineStatement_TheReceptive-2
data.value: Straight, square, and great. Though you practice nothing, there will be no disadvantage. Image: 'Straight, square, and great' - because the movement is correct and proper. 'Practice nothing, yet no disadvantage' - because the virtue of the earth is brilliant.

data.name: LineStatement_TheReceptive-3
data.value: Hidden excellence, yet you may be correct. If you serve the king, though you accomplish nothing, there will be a good end. Image: 'Hidden excellence, yet you may be correct' - because you can manifest it at the proper time. 'If you serve the king, though you accomplish nothing, there will be a good end' - because your wisdom is great and bright.

data.name: LineStatement_TheReceptive-4
data.value: A tied-up bag. No blame, no praise. Image: 'A tied-up bag, no blame' - because of caution there is no harm.

data.name: LineStatement_TheReceptive-5
data.value: Yellow lower garment. Supreme good fortune. Image: 'Yellow lower garment and supreme good fortune' - because the beauty is internal.

data.name: LineStatement_TheReceptive-6
data.value: Dragons fight in the wilderness. Their blood is black and yellow. Image: 'Dragons fight in the wilderness' - because their course is exhausted.

data.name: Statement_Return
data.value: Fù: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. Decision: Fù means 'return' or 'recurrence.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when one returns to the right path and proper principles, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and constancy are essential for proper return. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) returning to proper principles leads to favorable outcomes. 'Seven days and the return comes' - (because) natural cycles and proper timing govern all things. Image: Thunder in the midst of the earth - this forms the image of Fù. The superior man, in accordance with this, shuts his doors and keeps still.

data.name: LineStatement_Return-1
data.value: Return from a short distance. No need for regret. Great good fortune. Image: 'Return from a short distance' - by this he cultivates his person.

data.name: LineStatement_Return-2
data.value: Excellent return. Good fortune. Image: The good fortune of 'excellent return' - because he is benevolent to those below.

data.name: LineStatement_Return-3
data.value: Frequent returns. Danger, but no blame. Image: The danger of frequent returns - but there is no blame in righteousness.

data.name: LineStatement_Return-4
data.value: Walking the middle path and returning alone. Image: 'Walking the middle path and returning alone' - by following the way.

data.name: LineStatement_Return-5
data.value: Sincere return. No regret. Image: 'Sincere return, no regret' - by examining himself with the mean.

data.name: LineStatement_Return-6
data.value: Mistaken return. Misfortune. There will be disaster. If you use armies, you will finally have great defeat. If you are the ruler of the state, misfortune. Even for ten years, you cannot conquer. Image: The misfortune of 'mistaken return' - is contrary to the way of the ruler.

data.name: Statement_Approach
data.value: Lín: indicates great progress and success, while perseverance will be advantageous. But (it warns that) by the eighth month there will be misfortune. Decision: In Lín, the strong (yang lines) gradually advance and grow. There is joyousness and docility; the strong (line, the second nine) is in the central position and finds response. Through great penetration and correctness, one follows the way of Heaven. 'By the eighth month there will be misfortune' – because the decay (of the strong) will not be long in coming. Image: The earth above the lake forms the image of Lín (Approach). The superior man, in accordance with this, is unceasing in his teaching and thoughtfulness, and inexhaustible in his tolerance and protection of the people.

data.name: LineStatement_Approach-1
data.value: Approaching with widespread influence (or: through feeling). Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: 'Approaching with influence. Perseverance brings good fortune.' – For the will is carried out in a correct way.

data.name: LineStatement_Approach-2
data.value: Approaching with widespread influence. All is auspicious, and nothing is disadvantageous. Image: 'Approaching with influence. All is auspicious.' – (This is so even though the one above) has not yet (fully) complied with (the natural course of) things.

data.name: LineStatement_Approach-3
data.value: Approaching with sweet words (or: complacent oversight). Nothing advantageous. If one becomes anxious about this (and mends one's ways), there will be no blame. Image: 'Approaching with sweet words' – (this is because) the position is not appropriate (a weak line on a strong place). 'If one becomes anxious about it' – the blame will not be long-lasting.

data.name: LineStatement_Approach-4
data.value: Approaching in the highest sense (or: direct, intimate oversight). No blame. Image: 'Approaching in the highest sense. No blame.' – (Because) the position is appropriate.

data.name: LineStatement_Approach-5
data.value: Wise approach (or: overseeing with wisdom). This is fitting for a great prince. Good fortune. Image: 'This is fitting for a great prince' – (it means) to act in accordance with the Mean (the central path).

data.name: LineStatement_Approach-6
data.value: Sincere, magnanimous approach (or: oversight). Good fortune. No blame. Image: The good fortune of 'sincere, magnanimous approach' – (comes from) the will being directed inward (toward one's own people/country).

data.name: Statement_Peace
data.value: Tài: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. The superior man will attain his purpose by means of small advances. Decision: Tài means 'peace' or 'greatness.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when Heaven and Earth are in harmony, all things flourish. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) constancy in virtue leads to lasting success. 'The superior man will attain his purpose by means of small advances' - (because) gradual progress is more sustainable than rash action. Image: Heaven and earth unite - this forms the image of Tài. The superior man, in accordance with this, brings together the noble and the common people, and maintains harmony among all classes.

data.name: LineStatement_Peace-1
data.value: He pulls up the grass, coming up with it. Each with his class. Going forward will be good fortune. Image: 'Pulling up the grass and going forward will be good fortune' - his will is directed outward.

data.name: LineStatement_Peace-2
data.value: He bears with the uncultivated, crosses the Yellow River. He does not neglect those at a distance. His friends are gone, but he gets the middle way. Image: 'Bearing with the uncultivated' - he gets the middle way, by which his virtue is made great and bright.

data.name: LineStatement_Peace-3
data.value: No plain not sloping, no going not returning. When difficult, persevere and there will be no blame. Do not worry about your sincerity. In food there will be blessing. Image: 'No going not returning' - because this is the border of heaven and earth.

data.name: LineStatement_Peace-4
data.value: Fluttering, not wealthy, relying on his neighbors. Not using warning because of sincerity. Image: 'Fluttering, not wealthy' - all lose their substance. 'Not using warning because of sincerity' - the will of the heart is directed to it.

data.name: LineStatement_Peace-5
data.value: The emperor gives his sister in marriage. With blessings, great good fortune. Image: 'With blessings, great good fortune' - because his will is carried out by the middle path.

data.name: LineStatement_Peace-6
data.value: The city walls return to moats. Do not use armies. From the city, declare commands. Perseverance will be disadvantageous. Image: 'The city walls return to moats' - his commands are confused.

data.name: Statement_ThePowerOfTheGreat
data.value: Dà Zhuàng: indicates that (under its conditions) it will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Decision: Dà Zhuàng means 'the power of the great' or 'great strength.' 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) when great power is properly directed and controlled by moral principles, success follows. 'The superior man will not advance to contend with anyone' - (because) true strength lies in self-restraint and proper conduct. 'The ram butts against the fence and gets his horns entangled' - (because) reckless use of power leads to entrapment. Image: Thunder in heaven above - this forms the image of Dà Zhuàng. The superior man, in accordance with this, does not take any step that is not in accordance with propriety.

data.name: LineStatement_ThePowerOfTheGreat-1
data.value: Power in the toes. To go forward will be unlucky. You will be sincere. Image: 'Power in the toes' - his sincerity will come to an end.

data.name: LineStatement_ThePowerOfTheGreat-2
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: The second nine, 'perseverance brings good fortune' - because he is in the center.

data.name: LineStatement_ThePowerOfTheGreat-3
data.value: The inferior man uses power. The superior man does not use it. Perseverance will be dangerous. A ram butts against fence and entangles its horns. Image: 'The inferior man uses power' - the superior man does not act thus.

data.name: LineStatement_ThePowerOfTheGreat-4
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. Regret disappears. The fence is broken and does not entangle. Power in the great carriage's felloes. Image: 'The fence is broken' - it is advantageous to go forward.

data.name: LineStatement_ThePowerOfTheGreat-5
data.value: He loses his ram in the easy place. No regret. Image: 'He loses his ram in the easy place' - his position is not appropriate.

data.name: LineStatement_ThePowerOfTheGreat-6
data.value: A ram butts against fence and cannot retreat, cannot accomplish. No advantage. When difficult, good fortune. Image: 'Cannot retreat' and 'cannot accomplish' - this is inauspicious. 'When difficult, good fortune' - the blame will not be long-lasting.

data.name: Statement_BreakThrough
data.value: Guài: indicates (the necessity of) making a declaration in the royal court, and with sincere earnestness proclaiming (the offender's) guilt. There is peril (in this). (One should) make the announcement to his own city. It is not advantageous to resort to arms at once. What is advantageous is to undertake some (decisive) action. Decision: Guài means 'to resolve' or 'to decide,' indicating the strong deciding about the weak. (It shows the attributes of) strength and joyousness – resolution leading to harmony. 'Making a declaration in the royal court' – (because) the weak (line, the top six) rides on five strong lines. 'With sincere earnestness proclaiming the danger' – the peril (of the situation) is thus made clear to all. 'Making the announcement to his own city. It is not advantageous to resort to arms at once' – for the course (of force) advocated would be exhausted. 'What is advantageous is to undertake some action' – (for) the growth of the strong (power) will thereby be brought to its conclusion. Image: The lake rises to heaven – this forms the image of Guài. The superior man, in accordance with this, bestows blessings (or emoluments) upon those below. If he were to hoard his virtue, it would give cause for resentment.

data.name: LineStatement_BreakThrough-1
data.value: Strong (like one) advancing with the forward foot. To go forward (so rashly) will lead to failure and blame. Image: 'To go forward without the prospect of success' – this leads to blame.

data.name: LineStatement_BreakThrough-2
data.value: Crying out with alarm and vigilance. Though armed men come at night, have no fear. Image: 'Though armed men come, have no fear.' – (Because he) has attained the central path.

data.name: LineStatement_BreakThrough-3
data.value: Strong in the cheekbones (showing anger). There is misfortune. The superior man is resolute in his decision. He walks alone and encounters rain (which wets him). (Though) he is annoyed at being drenched, there will be no blame. Image: 'The superior man is resolute in his decision' – in the end, there will be no blame.

data.name: LineStatement_BreakThrough-4
data.value: No skin on his buttocks; he walks with difficulty. If he leads the sheep (the strong mass below), regret will vanish. But though he hears these words, he does not believe them. Image: 'He walks with difficulty' – (because) the position is not appropriate (a strong line on a weak place). 'Though he hears these words, he does not believe them' – (for) his hearing (and understanding) is not clear.

data.name: LineStatement_BreakThrough-5
data.value: (He is like) the delicate xianlu plant (which is hard to uproot). He is resolute in his decision. Acting from the central position, there will be no blame. Image: 'Acting from the central position brings no blame' – (but) the centrality (of his virtue) is not yet brilliantly displayed.

data.name: LineStatement_BreakThrough-6
data.value: No cry (is of any avail). In the end, there will be misfortune. Image: The misfortune of 'no cry (availing)' – (means this state of affairs) cannot last long in the end.

data.name: Statement_Waiting
data.value: Xū: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. Decision: Xū means 'waiting' or 'need.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when one waits patiently for the right time, success follows. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) constancy and patience are essential virtues. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) proper timing enables one to overcome great obstacles. 'In the city, there is no need to resort to arms' - (because) patience and forbearance are more effective than force. Image: Clouds rise up to heaven - this forms the image of Xū. The superior man, in accordance with this, eats and drinks, and is cheerful and of good courage.

data.name: LineStatement_Waiting-1
data.value: Waiting in the meadow. It will be advantageous to remain constant. No blame. Image: 'Waiting in the meadow' - because he does not act rashly.

data.name: LineStatement_Waiting-2
data.value: Waiting on the sand. There will be some whispering and defamation. In the end, good fortune. Image: The whispering and defamation come from being too relaxed (in the position).

data.name: LineStatement_Waiting-3
data.value: Waiting in the mud. This brings robbers. Image: 'Waiting in the mud brings robbers' - because disaster comes from without.

data.name: LineStatement_Waiting-4
data.value: Waiting in blood. Get out of the pit. Image: 'Waiting in blood' - because he is following what is proper.

data.name: LineStatement_Waiting-5
data.value: Waiting at wine and food. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: The good fortune of the fifth nine comes from his being in the central position and correct.

data.name: LineStatement_Waiting-6
data.value: Unexpected guests arrive. One treats them respectfully, and in the end there will be good fortune. Image: The arrival of unexpected guests - although not at the proper time, one should treat them respectfully.

data.name: Statement_HoldingTogether
data.value: Bǐ: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. Decision: Bǐ means 'holding together' or 'union.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when people unite with a common purpose, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) proper principles and constancy are essential for lasting unity. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) genuine unity leads to favorable outcomes. 'Seeking union with those of the same mind' - (because) true fellowship is based on shared values and principles. Image: Water on the earth - this forms the image of Bǐ. The superior man, in accordance with this, bestows his favors and gathers people around him.

data.name: LineStatement_HoldingTogether-1
data.value: Have sincerity and be united. No blame. If sincerity is full to the brim, there will at the end be others. Good fortune. Image: The first six, 'be united' - others coming brings good fortune.

data.name: LineStatement_HoldingTogether-2
data.value: Be united from within. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: 'Be united from within' - you do not lose yourself.

data.name: LineStatement_HoldingTogether-3
data.value: Be united with those who are not the right men. Image: 'Be united with those who are not the right men' - is this not also hurtful!

data.name: LineStatement_HoldingTogether-4
data.value: Be united externally. Perseverance brings good fortune. Image: 'Be united externally with the worthy' - by following those above.

data.name: LineStatement_HoldingTogether-5
data.value: Manifest union. The king uses three drives to chase, but loses the game before. The people of the city do not warn him. Good fortune. Image: The good fortune of 'manifest union' - the position is correct and central. He rejects the contrary and takes the compliant, thereby losing the former game.

data.name: LineStatement_HoldingTogether-6
data.value: Be united without a head. Misfortune. Image: 'Be united without a head' - there is no conclusion.
